Blog.post: Biking Today Saturday afternoon, I went biking on the Alameda Creek Trails, with my friends Rex, George, and Ruby. They all met at my house, and we went off biking! The weather was pretty good, sunny and cool...no overcast...perfect for biking. The trail is pretty cool, and it's my third or fourth time riding it. It has a very good varienty of terains, inclines, declines, easy parts, and hard. Overall, its a challenging yet doable trail. Some parts of the trail were still soft and muddy from the rain, which made it a tougher ride than usually. But the next time we all go, we're planning on biking all the way to the Dumbarton bridge! Rex and George...no more excuses! After biking, we all had lunch at the house. I baked some Totinos Combination pizza! My favorite frozen pizza! Good size, and good price! Then we played some Sega Dreamcast games, like hockey and Crazy Taxi. Crazy taxi is so much fun! If you ever get a chance to play it, I suggest you play it! After my friends left, I worked on the garage. I assembled a storage cabinet for the garage, that I bought at Lowes. I'm trying to clear the garage, before the house warming party in a few weeks. There are lots of books and boxes that need to be organized, hence the 3 storage cabinets I bought. It's coming along nicely...but lots to do! Tonight a few of my friends are going clubbing in SF. I'm not sure if I want to go, since I'm so tired and broke. I need to save some cash for Christmas gifts, which is just around the corner! But why not, I might as well go. Nothing else to do.

I feel sore After almost 2 hours of basketball last night, the aches and pains are starting to kick in this morning. I'm feeling some soreness in the muscles I haven't used in a quite a while, mostly in my legs. Running full court non stop was pretty hard and challenging, since we've usually played half court in the past. But it feels good to get the heart pumping again! Run to the Far Side I guess it's good, because there is an upcoming 10K marathon, in San Francisco. On Sunday, December 1st, it starts in golden gate park at 8:30AM. urlLink Check it out! A couple of my friends are doing it, and sounds doable. I'm trying to get Olivia to join, since she'll be here that weekend! Olivia loves to run...once a year, that is! lazy bum! =) But we're having a family house warming party the day before, so I don't know if I'll have enough energy the next morning to run 10K. We'll see. Beautiful Day Yes, today is a beautiful day. Despite the rain and cold, it's nice to see everything wet. It's also fun watching everyone carrying umbrellas to work, and walking really fast outside. It's also cool watching someone's umbrella turn inside out from a quick just of wind! Anyone see one yet? I have my eyes on the lookout! =)

City Beach Today after work, my coworkers and I are going to play basketball at urlLink City Beach ! We've been playing bball outdoors every Thursday after work. Since it's been getting dark early and the weather is getting colder, urlLink Covad has sponsored us for 10 weeks at City Beach in Santa Clara! It's just about 3 minutes away from my work. It should be fun playing indoors, and City Beach is a nice place! I need to start getting into shape! again!

Go Covad Cool, I just found out today that urlLink Covad met their numbers for Q3 2002! You know what that means...BONUS! Yes, all employees get a bonus! Well, since they implemented a new equation to calculate our bonus, some complicated equation no one can figure out...we only get 82% of the bonus, which isn't bad! Since I started working at Covad, not once have we missed our numbers! So far every quarter I've been at Covad, I've had an extra amount tacked onto my paycheck! GO COVAD! Hope this trend continues!
Adding Comments Now I'm trying to add comments to my blog entries. Seems like a much needed feature to blogging. Let's see if this works!

My First Blog Greetings! This is my first blog on my new w urlLink ebsite. Hope this works! I've been inspired by urlLink Olivia to get into blogging, since I read her blogs everyday! We'll see how long I can last! =)

Simple Fridays Nothing much happened today. Went to work, did my thing. I did have lunch with urlLink Rex and urlLink George at a Japanese place in Santa Clara. I ordered the house special, which included 6 california rolls, teriyake chicken, miso soup, salad, tempura, and vegetables. I couldn't finish my meal, because Rex wanted to split some dragon rolls! If Rex hasn't been to a place in a long time, he'll order more than he can finish, just to make up for the lost time. One time he ordered a 12 piece family meal from Popeyes Chicken for himself, because its been a few months! Oh boy! After work, I came home. I chatted with urlLink Dale for a while, and we were on the verge of going to LA for the weekend, to go try out for American Idol II. Dale wanted to go, but was hesitant on going, due the long lines already forming. And the fact that it starts on monday. I tried encouraging him to just go, and offered to go and try out, too! Despite all efforts, we ended up talking via Netmeeting, and trying to setup his video conferencing. No luck. Tomorrow morning I'm going biking with Rex, George, and urlLink Albert ...we're going to conquer the Dumbarton Bridge! We'll see if we can make it!

Nice and Sweaty! I played basketball again tonight with my coworkers at urlLink City Beach . I'm still not getting used to this full court running, but it definitely feels good getting my heart pumping again. My team won 3 of 4 games, not a bad night. The 4th game, everyone felt too tired to run, so my team pushed ourselves, and won on fast breaks. After 2 hours, I was sweating like a pig! Dinner at the Louies After bball, I had dinner at my friends' new home in EPA, urlLink Mark and urlLink Diana . Every Thursday or so they have "Arts and Crafts" night, where someone cooks dinner at the house. This week my friend Johannah cooked cashew chicken, with green beans and onions! But she forgot to buy cashews! It turned out really delicious and yummy! Good job urlLink Johannah ! We also had icecream for dessert! We watched Friends, which actually wasn't too great of an episode. Seems they're running out of ideas! It may be their last season! Wedding Fever! Tonight we also found out that our friends urlLink Nina and urlLink George urlLink are engaged! Nina told us the whole story, and it was really sweet how George proposed! I won't go into detail, but it was a great story! I'm really happy for the both of them, and they're such a great couple! They've been together for almost 5 years! Nina got a fat shiny rock on her finger! Good job George, and Congrats to you both! Yes, for some reason, a lot of my friends from Santa Clara are getting married! Next year, I know of 6 weddings planned! What's going on here? There's definitely wedding fever among my circle of friends...and many keep asking me when Olivia and I are next. We'll, when Olivia asks me, I'll say YES! =) BTW - I miss my girlfriend urlLink Olivia . She's now a Matlab programmer!
I found my favorite picture of my girlfriend while going through my old old websites.... urlLink =)

8th Grade Class Reunion in the Works I graduated from Elementary School 10 years ago! Class of 1992, Our Lady of Perpetual Help, Daly City! Organizing a reunion for our entire class is a side project my friend Glenn and I are toying with. Glenn came over last night, and we called up a former classmate, Monica Vasquez. Wow, I haven't seen her or talked with her in 8 years! We called her up, and talked for over an hour. It was great talking with her, and finding out what she was up to. She's finally in love and married, working for a company called "Marsh", and bought a new home! We all caught up with what we've all been doing, and it was nice to re-unite via phone, with someone you spent your early elementary days with. It put a smile on my face! =) She's now officially part of our planning committee, and will help in the research and searching of our former classmates at OLPH! We were all excited about the idea, and are looking forward to it...hopefully sometime early 2003. Monica wanted to have pretty invitations and make party favors! Wow, Glenn and I could use someone like that to work with. She had a few good ideas, too! We're even going to invite Mrs. Lucett, our 8th grade teacher! She currently teaches 8th grade at OLPH! And our former principle still drives the same brown Trans Am, and parks in the same parking spot! Memories! Can't wait to see what happens!
If condoms had sponsors... My sister Abby loves to spam me with forwards! This is one of them.... urlLink Click here

Serendipity Yes, I finally watched the movie Serendipity! After hearing so much about this movie, I finally watched it on DVD. WOW!!!! What a great romantic comedy! It's officially my new favorite chick flick movie of all time. I immediately feel in love with the characters, Jonathan and Sara..and their whole story of fate! John Cusack and Kate Beckinsale were terrific together! Kate Beckinsale is my new favorite actress...she was yummy with that english accent! BTW, was that her real accent or fake? Either way, she was hot! (not as hot as olivia, btw)! =) It was also cool seeing the places in NYC where the scenes took place, because I recognized a lot of it from my trip to NYC a few months ago! Like Central Park, the icerink, the subway...all those typical New York things. Overall, I just thought it was a very sweet and clever movie! It just makes you believe that there is such a thing as FATE!

Lazy Sunday Don't you just love lazy Sundays? I stayed in my pjs for most of the day. Great football games today, too! Niners whooped some bootie! They're doing really well this season, and it's great having a home team that wins! Go Niners! My garage project is coming along, still organizing all our junk! I still have shelves to put up for all our books. For lunch, I cooked top ramen after Olivia mentioned what she was eating...top ramen! Yes, Healthy!!! Oh, that reminds of what Olivia saw today! Well, you'll have to find out in her journal if she decides to share her story...but boy oh boy, I couldn't stop laughing! =) Another girl friend Whoa, having a personal website takes a lot from one's day! I mean a lot! Before you know it, a few hours pass by, or even a whole day is gone, all towards a website! That's the main reason I stopped working on my old website. My old site took so much from my day, I didn't realize how many hours had gone by...just to create a cool looking website. What ends up happening is that the site only last so long, before you're tired of it, the layout or look...that you start all over again! Yes, an endless cycle. But I must admit it is fun! I do enjoy making a website, putting up pictures, journals, pages, layouts, etc. It's fun trying to be creative, and putting a part of yourself online to share with the world. I just don't know how long I can keep up with this site, and how much more of my time I'm willing to sacrifice towards it. It's like having another girl friend! That is definitely something I don't need. =) But until Olivia gets back from NY, I can spare some time making a website. I give myself a week or two. Fruits of my Labor So my day resulted with some a few new things. I added a "Search by Name" menu, to search for friends within my photo albums. You can search by a friend's name, and see all the pictures I have of them. I also added some old pictures I had from my old old website, and new albums as well. urlLink 61 Albums now! With Olivia's help, I was able to get the pictures from my NYC visit up! Thanks for resizing the images Olivia! She found a great program that does batch image resizing, so I could resize my digital shots. So I resized a bunch of pics, and ftp them to my server. I also threw in a simple random image script to add some color to my gray looking site. And that's about it. The fruits of my website labor! I'd say I spent about 5 hours today. Why? Why do I do this, you may ask? Actually, I asked myself that. You might say personal satisfaction...but deep down, I honestly think all I want is for someone to sign my guestbook or add a comment to my blog! It's exciting when you see that comment counter have a number next to it, or a new entry in your guestbook. Somehow, it makes it all worth while! 0 comments bite! I'm sure there's a whole psychology behind personal websites and blogging...someone should write a book. I'll be the first to read it.

Nikki's House Warming Party My highschool friend urlLink Nikki threw a house warming party, for her new apartment in S.F. George urlLink and urlLink Charles urlLink met at my house around 2pm, and I drove to the city. Oh boy, when we got to Nikki's place, there was so much food! George, Charles, and I haven't seen so much food in a long time, that we said our hellos, and dug right in! We weren't expecting a feast, but a feast we got! All sorts of filipino dishes! Lot's of meat dishes, too! I ate a lot, but I think Charles ate the most! Mr. Charles times 2! Nikki's place was pretty nice, 2-3 blocks from urlLink USF , great location. A bunch of her family and friends were there. A few of my SHC friends went, like Justin Lee, urlLink Christina Devera , and her bf Domingo. It was nice seeing them again, and catching up, like good old times. It's amazning, but we all agreed that we all look the same. Slight changes, but each one of us hasn't changed too drastically. I still look the same. We all look the same! We also gave ourselves a tour, since Nikki was busy entertaining her guests. We went into Nikkis room, and Charles, the joker he is, decided to take some pictures of us with her camera. It was just lying there, so we took some funny shots of us around her room. We can't wait when she develops her roll! =) Chess After the party, I drove home and played some chess with urlLink Ben , my little sister's boyfriend. I must admit, I love chess. I'm not great, but its fun learning strategy an attacks. I beat Ben maybe 4 out 5 times, on the average. I like it when he puts up a fight, and actually pins me into Checkmate. Most of the time, it's careless moves that give me the win. I just need to play more, and get exposed to different styles. I'm so used to playing Ben, and his opening game. Anyone out there want to play? Lot's to Do Sunday I have to start preparing for our family house warming party a week from today! Lot's to do! - Clear the garage - Vacuum the house - Clear boxes - Setup chairs - Buy Groceries - Setup decorations and Xmas lights - move furniture - clear my room. But I can't wait to see all my family and relatives I haven't seen in a long time! Cousins I haven't seen in years! Hopefully the weather is nice, and they all make it! I love family reunions! 4 Days and counting urlLink Olivia comes back home in 4 days!!!!

More Exercise I played basketball again at City Beach with my coworkers. Only 8 showed up, so we had to do more running than usual. We played 4 games, and had about 20 minutes to spare. For some reason, as much as I try to stay active, I can't build up stamina. I should start watching what I eat! Too much fast food and frozen dinners. But they're so convenient, tastes good, and affordable! But yes, I should stop ordering fries! Headache!!!! My head was throbbing when I got home last night. And it was painful. I'm assuming it was because I walked outside the gym all sweaty, and I wore shorts and a t-shirt. So I took some tylenol, and went to sleep around 9pm. I feel better now. Up so Early! It's about 5:30am, and I'm awake! It's because I slept in so early. Usually I'm in bed around midnight, so now my whole schedule is off by 3 hrs! Instead of falling asleep around 1pm today during work, I'll feel sleepy around 10am today. Counting the Days! Olivia is flying back this wednesday, for the Thanksgiving Holidays! I'm counting the days!!!! I should try to find one of those counters, that count down the time. =)

Tennis After work, I played tennis with urlLink Johannah at the urlLink Santa Clara University tennis courts. Courts are for students and faculty, but luckily my little sister urlLink Audrey is a Sophomore at SCU. I borrowed her student id card to get in. Boy, I haven't played in a few years, so I was a bit rusty. Johannah was a beginner, so she gave me a chance to warm up and find my stroke. She was pretty good and we had some good rallies. I had a good workout, and a nice sore tennis elbow! There were these 3 little mexican kids, that would steal our balls that went over the fence. It was funny watching them and their technique, trying to be sneaky and smooth. They would seemingly run towards the ball's general area...and just stand by the ball for a brief moment, look around to see if anyone was looking. One would continue to play, while another kept a look out. The 3rd would bend down slowly, pick up the ball, stand back up slowly while looking to see if anyone saw him...then with ball in posession, they ran. I watch this technique twice! I had 2 balls stolen by them, and I didn't mind. But the 3rd ball that went over was actually a new ball...so I knew what they were up to! When they started working their way towards the ball...I waited. I waited for the moment the 3rd kid would bend down. Right when he was about to pick it up..i said, "Thank you!" and waved my racquet indicating that it was my ball. I know, I'm mean. But hey, it was a new ball! The Bachelor I watched the Bachelor finale tonight. I think he made a good choice. The girl was pretty, down to earth, in tune with her emotions towards the guys and more importantly with herself. It was cute how he proposed, and you could tell that she was the right one for him. I predicted they'll last a year or two. They're coming out with The Bacholorette! That should be intersting!

Busy week at Work So far Monday and Tuesday at work has been pretty busy. My manager assigned me to work on the ATT Worldnet project, since they're now offering DSL services through Covad. Well, we got our requirements late from ATT, which pushed our schedule back. So I had to stay late on Monday to finish up the work and test our deployment to production. Petty stressful, but it went well, despite the last minute code changes and requirement docs from ATT. All is well that ends well. That's work! Updated my Albums Olivia has been reporting bugs in my website. She is my website quality assurance person! When you search someone's name, sometimes pics of others show up. So I had to fix what I could...but too many pics to go through. But thanks for all your input Olivia. Other than that, just playing around with some drop down menus...example on the calendar page. But no time to put that together. Oh well, come back next year! Oh No! I'm getting lazy blogging now. I missed yesterday. I predict I'll be a weekly blogger soon!

Conquering the Bridge Saturday I went biking with urlLink Rex , urlLink George , and urlLink Albert . Today we decided attempt to bike to the Dumbarton Bridge. It's been our goal since we started biking, and I'm glad to say that we finally biked all the way OVER the bridge! Yes, we reached our goal and pushed ourselves over the Dumbarton! We biked from my house, through the hills, to the bridge, over the bridge, and finally back to my house! It actually wasn't as bad as we thought, and was quite doable. But we've been biking almost every weekend, so the conditioning helped! I'd say we biked around 18 miles. Albert, was pretty good for his first time biking with us. But he has an $800 Specialized bike, which was lite and soft. My bike was free, which Olivia won in a raffle at Berkeley. I like it and it works well, but after lifting Albert's bike...mine felt 4 times heavier. I shall start looking for a new bike! Eat Fresh After biking, we had lunch at Subway, eat fresh. We then came to my house, and played some basketball, 2 on 2. Saturday was a non stop workout, I swear. But I'm burning fat and working my heart, so I'm happy about it! Shelves After they left, I finally got around to building some book shelves in my garage. I still have about 5 boards to put up, but it's coming along nicely. Party Da urlLink rren and his housemates threw a party last night. Pretty crazy party, I knew about 10 people or so. Lot's of random people walking in and out. It was fun hanging out, until someone decided to through some fire crackers/flares at the house. We were all inside, when we heard this big BOOM, and saw smoke. Someone opened the door, and then another BOOM hit. I swear it felt like we were under attack! Everyone was shocked, and started to freak out. One SCU alum, Adela, was walking to her car, and almost got hit by the firecracker. She actually got a burn behind her ankles, and fell to the ground. The cops, ambulance, fire trucks all came by immediately. That's when everyone left and the party ended. Rex and I stayed for a little after the whole madness. I finally got home, it's about 3am. Wow, crazy night. But that how Darren's party usually turn out.

No Music My mom borrowed my car on Monday, to do some shopping for the house warming party on Saturday. So I took her car to work. She never told me her car stereo is busted, so I couldn't listen to music or my AM stations in the morning. Yes, I listen to AM now...news and sports. But wow, driving without a radio is tough! I ended up singing to myself to make my drive faster. "Cuz I'm freeeeee...freeeee fallin!" Don't know why, but I sang that all the way to work. Same line over and over, cuz that's all the words I know. Grandfather's Clock My mom has gone shopping crazy this past month. Buying stuff for the house. She bought a huge Grandfather's clock, something she claims she always wanted. "But you'll inherit this when I die! You're the lucky one!" she exclaimed when I asked her why!! Wonderful, I'm going to have a grandfathers clock someday! Olivia's coming home!!! Tonight I'm picking up my girlfriend from the Airport! She's back for the Thanksgiving Holidays! I'm excited, it's been over a month since she last came!

3 Year Anniversary Today! Today, December 4th, marks the 3-Year Anniversary of Olivia and I! Happy 3 Year Anniversary Olivia! 14352! 3 years ago, Olivia and I were in Berkeley, hanging out one weekend. That evening, we were starving, so we decided to go along Ashby to find a place to eat. Being the college students we were, on a budget, we ended up going to our favorite fast food place, Jack in the Box! This Jack in the Box was cool, because it had a bullet proof drive-though. We both love their 2 tacos for 99 cents, and their 99-cent Jumbo Jack, so we ordered our meal. That night, I was planning to ask her to be my girlfriend, because it was the 4th, one of Olivia's favorite numbers. I had it all planned out! Well, during the day, we joked around about how we should be officially boyfriend/girlfriend. We've been dating for quite a while, but never had that official title. I joked around, about how I wasn't going to ask her. "It's the 21st century, and women seem to be dominating the world. So the only way we'd be official, is if she would ask me! The girl should ask the guy!" So that's what I told her, jokingly. =) The night was winding down, and I was planning to ask her after dinner. As we were driving out of the bullet proof drive through, she asked me if I was going to ask her! With one of my tacos in my hand, and my 99 cent Jumbo Jack in my mouth, I teased her by saying, "No, you have to ask me!” and took a huge bite of my burger. In the back of my mind, I knew I was going to ask her.. but I loved teasing Olivia about it! As I took another bite of my Jumbo Jack, she said to..."Alan, will you be my boyfriend?" I swear I almost choked! I was so surprised! I didn't expect her at all to ask me! Well, at first I said, "NO! You weren't supposed to ask me! What are you doing!!!" She replied, "Well, since you're not going to ask me, I'm asking you!" So I said "Yes! I'll be your boyfriend!" I confessed "I was going to ask you after dinner, and not with a Jumbo Jack in my mouth!" So every time I eat a Jumbo Jack now, I remember Olivia asking me to be her boyfriend! Wow, a woman of the 21st century! Now our running joke is that I'm not going to ask her to marry me. It's the 21st century, so she'll have to ask me to marry her! =) Happy 3 Year Anniversary Olivia! I love you!

House Warming Party!!! Saturday, November 30th, was our family house warming party! Finally, the day came and gone! With all the work and preparation, we got the job done! We invited all our friends, family, relatives, cousins, aunts and uncles, coworkers, and all. I guess anywhere from about 150-200 people came, so we had a pretty large turn out throughout the whole day and night! We had lot's and lots of food, too! I gained another 5lbs A lot of my relatives came, that I haven't seen in a long time. It was great seeing my cousins, and hanging out like good old times. My grandparents came, and uncle and aunts I haven't seen in a while. Every five minutes someone new doorbelled and came inside. My parents invited their coworkers, so half the people who attended I didn't know. But I met them all, and it was pleasant meeting the people my parents work with. Olivia's parents and family came, too! Thanks Auntie Dolly for helping cook the lumpia! My mom appreciated your help! The priest from St. Anne's Parish came to bless our new home. I picked him up at noon, and he brought his bible and holy water to give a blessing. With candles in hand, the guests joined in the prayer and blessing, as father blessed every corner of the house with holy water. Father was really kind and generous with his time and blessings. He couldn't stay too long, so I dropped him back to St. Annes before 1pm. I actually had a great conversation with Father when I picked him up and dropped him off. We talked about the Church, and how he bacame a priest. I asked him lot's of questions, personal ones, and he shared his stories openly! I asked if he had a calling to join the priesthood, a kind of revelation or calling. He said no. Not really. His family was very religious, and growing up, he was surrounded by family and prayer..so it was a big part of his life. He remembers as a little 5 year old, his drawings were of Churches, Alters, Crosses, and religious symbols! When he was a teen, a family friend's son was interested in joining the Seminary, and they asked Father to accompany the son. He did, and found the Seminary fascinating. Father later decided to join, and his family friend's son didn't. So he that's how he started. Back to the house warming party. We had a lot's of food. Lot's of guests. And definitely lot's of fun. It was fun, especially for my family to have people over to entertain and host. I played bartender throughout the day, mixing drinks and serving alcohol. I'm not any good, but it was fun pretending. I totally re-did our garage, with storage shelves, book shelves, a new bar setup with music and speakers, the ping pong table, fooseball table, and some carpet remnants. It looked likes a bachelor pad hangout, but the guests seemed to enjoy the garage. Entertainment People found ways to entertain themselves throughout the night. We had ping pong and foosball in the garage. Also the open bar which I worked for a while...at the same time I acted as Mr. DJ, playing the same 3 cds over and over, Raggae and Disco. Others played basketball outside, while inside many sang kareoke songs all night long! No filipino party is complete without Kareoke! Some even danced! The kids played board games, thanks to Olivia and her scrabble. Thanks for bringing all your stuff! Many enjoyed the variety of filipino foods and desserts. Many seemed to enjoy socializing with different people, reuniting with other family, and also meeting new people. And many simply enjoyed seeing our new house and having a tour of the our new home! We recieved many generous compliments of our new home, and my mom was happy people loved her decorating style. Even though my sisters and I don't appreciate her taste in Cappo di Monte, and the color gold...we did appreciate my mom putting time and effort into making our house a beautiful home! As the night came to and end, just my close family was left. We opened all the wonderful house warming gifts from everyone! We recieved a lot of crystal bowls and plates, baking ware, flowers, a bar set, vases, gift certificates, and some cash. We then watched the digital shots I took throughout the day! Lot's of pictures!!!! Truly Blessed My family had a great time, and we all feel truly blessed with all the blessings God has given us. Sunday morning I went to my parents bed, and we just talked about how lucky our family is. We are truly blessed, with family and friends, and a new beautiful home. We were talking about how we ended up here, all by luck and chance, hardwork, and the good graciousness of God. We talked about the house warming party, and how much fun we all had. My parents really enjoyed themselves, and seeing all our relatives and friends again. Thanks again! Thanks again to all who attended! Our home is your home, and you're always welcome!

Holiday Shopping The Friday after Thanksgiving, is definitely the busiest and craziest shopping day of the year! I did go shopping, but didn't really buy much. My mom on the other had, did buy quite a few stuff. My mom, Audrey, Ben, and I woke up at 5am, and went to Union Landing shopping area. We shopped at stores like Walmart, Party America, Linens and Things, Micheals, and Longs Drug. We had lot's to buy for the House Warming party, like drinks and supplies, plates, spoons, forks, and food. We bought about 50 2 liter sodas, at Longs for only $.39 cents! My mom bought a TV, 3 dvd players, and some bathroom stuff. My sister, Ben, and I didn't buy too much. I just got a shower curtain for my bathroom, since mine is already a year old and needed replacement. So I was pretty good with the shopping madness!

Holiday Shopping The Friday after Thanksgiving, is definitely the busiest and craziest shopping day of the year! I did go shopping, but didn't really buy much. My mom on the other had, did buy quite a few stuff. My mom, Audrey, Ben, and I woke up at 5am, and went to Union Landing shopping area. We shopped at stores like Walmart, Party America, Linens and Things, Micheals, and Longs Drug. We had lot's to buy for the House Warming party, like drinks and supplies, plates, spoons, forks, and food. We bought about 50 2 liter sodas, at Longs for only $.39 cents! My mom bought a TV, 3 dvd players, and some bathroom stuff. My sister, Ben, and I didn't buy too much. I just got a shower curtain for my bathroom, since mine is already a year old and needed replacement. So I was pretty good with the shopping madness!

Thanksgiving Feast I spent Thanksgiving with Olivia's family, and had a wonderful dinner! Olivia's mom prepared a lot of delicious food, like Turkey, mash potatoes, gravy, honey baked ham, bread, and lobster! Yes, the turkey was good, and so was the lobster! Huge sized lobster! Yummy! We also had some crab, brought by Olivia's aunt. Of course I ate a lot, and I think I gained 5lbs! I'll have to do some working out! During dinner, we played some counting games. One game, everyone had to close their eyes, and as a group, count down from 20 to 0, without 2 players saying a number at the same time! It was pretty funny when 2 people yelled out the same number! Every time that happened, we'd start all over. Challenging as it was, we were able to complete the game successfully. We also played a game called "Bizz Buzz" where you count numbers, and say 'Bizz" for multiples of 5, 'Buzz' for multiples of 7, and 'Bizz Buzz" for multiples of both 5 and 7. I was elimated after a few numbers! Too much thinking for a holiday break! But I had a good time! I was so full, too! We My family decided not to have Thanksgiving dinner at the house, because of the family house warming on Saturday. Lot's to prepare and cook, we'd just celebrate on Saturday.

Family Giving Tree Last night, I meet up with urlLink Diana , urlLink Mark , urlLink Albert , urlLink Garret , urlLink Johannah , and urlLink Shirley to volunteer for the urlLink Family Giving Tree ! We helped sort presents, organized them into bags, wrapped some gifts, and made sure no gifts were missing for the children on the lists. Oh boy, there were millions of gifts, all donated from generous people! The entire Cisco warerhouse was full of toys and presents! Each gift had a tag, which stated the name of the child, their age, and what they wished for Xmas. Some were really cute! A small 3 year old girl wanted a doll carriage, so we wrapped her one and threw in a cute doll. Another boy asked for "anything you have!" Another kid asked for "something warm to wear". Some were really innocent and cute! I liked the kids that weren't greedy, and asked for simple things, like a 'book to read or CD to listen to, and not both. They ended up getting both! There were tons of kids that asked for several things, and more expensive items like cd players, remote controlled cars, huge toy sets, watches, etc. Everyone got what they basically asked for! Seeing a large number of people volunteering their time for a good cause was nice to see, and put me into the holiday spirit. =) urlLink I took a few pictures!

Happy New Years! Happy New Years everyone! Hope you all had a happy New Years holiday! I can't believe 2003 is here! But I'm glad it is...because it's nice to have a fresh start. Coming up with resolutions are always fun, despite 2-3 weeks into the year, we tend to forget about them. Resolutions Just for fun, here are my resolutions for 2003: 1) Eat Healthier (1 piece of fruit or vegetable a day / less fast foods and fried items, less portions when I eat) 2) Be more Active / Physical everyday (stretching, ping-ping, 5 minutes of basketball...something physical daily) 3) Save money (i.e. spend less on wants, just on needs..avoid small items, save up for bigger things) 4) Develop my friendships deeper (keep in touch with old and new friends, make new ones, put more effort into relationships i have) 5) Be more Spiritual (I need to get back to being more spritual, put more effort in attending mass weekly, nightly reflections/prayer before i sleep) Sounds simple enough.

Crazy Weekend I had a pretty wild and crazy weekend. Cable Car Party for my 25th Birthday I celebrated my 25th Birthday on a Cable Car, through the streets of San Francisco! With my close friends and family, we partied hard and went crazy! It was a lot of fun! urlLink The pictures will tell the rest! Thank You Email To Everyone Hey everyone and Party People, I just wanted to thank you all who came to party last friday on the Cable Car Ride, to celebrate my 25th Bday! And to those who couldn't make it, I was hoping you were there with us. But thanks for all the emails and all the Happy Birthdays! I appreciate it! I must say that it was the wildest and most memorable birthday I have ever had, despite not remembering a thing from the last hour of the ride! It was a wild and crazy night, and I hope you all had as much fun as I did! For the first time, I honestly couldn't remember a thing, due to alcohol..at least what happened in the last hour! I didn't remember how I got off the cable car, who put me into my car, how I got home or who drove my car, and where I was in the morning when I woke up! All I remember in the last hour were several "Alan, drink this!", "Alan, are you ok?", and my head in a plastic bag. I do remember having a crazy time with everyone, cruising through SF, dancing at Velvet Lounge and Snowdrift, going up on stage with the band, seeing everyone having way too much to drink, the crazy looks of my intoxicated friends, taking shots, taking lot's of pictures, laughing, dancing and screaming, cussing, more shots, slapping people's asses, and my head in a plastic bag! (I apologize for my inappropriate behavior and language, and if I hurt or offended anyone...i was under the influence of alcohol =) I had a nasty hangover, and want to thank those that put shots in front of my face! You truly are my friends! When it's one's bday, the bday person tends to drink what's ever in front of them...so thanks for taking advantage of me on my special night, and sticking 151 in my face! I'll get you all back on your bdays! Really, I can't thank everyone enough for coming to party, and bringing bottles to share! And special thanks to my wonderful girlfriend Olivia, for setting this whole thing up! You are truly my other half and my everything! 143 -------- Pictures -------- We took a lot of pictures, which I posted on my new website. Visit www.alanabar.com to see the pics! On the main page, click on My Picture Gallery to view the Cable Car Party Album, and other old school pics! And if you haven't visited my site yet, you can also view all the pictures I have of you by selecting your name in the drop down menu, "Search by Name". All the pictures I have of since 1998 are up! Visit again as I post more pics from the past! See you all soon! -Alan

Wine Collecting Just from reading a few articles on wine, I have started an interest in wine. Wine in itself is an art, and only through time and experience can one truly appreciate good wine. Despite my complete lack of knowledge in wine, I wouldn't mine learning more about the different kinds and tastes, the history behind wine making, as well as the different makers. What better time than the present to start, I say. So I went to Cost Plus last night just to look at the different kinds of wine, and I got really excited looking at the endless selection. I didn't know where to start, or what to look for. Being as ignorant as a rock, I just started looking at the different brands. I read through the different labels, since some makers put a little history of themselves on the back. I of course noted the prices. Some bottles were amazingly expensive! I saw a bottle for over a thousand bucks, and only being a 1995 bottle. Others were pretty affordable, which I may start off buying, and work my way up. I think it would be fun collecting bottles of wine. All the 2002 wine are relative cheap, and I can only imagine how much value it would be worth 5, 10, 20 years down the line. So in 2022, a bottle of 2002 wine would sound really old! I ended up not buying anything. =) I figure I'd read up on wine and get educated first, before I start investing.

Jet Blue - the only way to fly! I finally took Jet Blue for the first time last night, on my way to New York. I must say that it was the best airline experience I have ever had! I've heard so many good things about JetBlue, and I can finally see why! Believe the hype that you hear! Despite the flight being half an hour late, due to weather conditions, the overall flight was great. As we entered the plan, they passed out headphones. Each seat has a video monitor for you to watch direct TV! This itself makes flying JetBlue worth every penny. I was able to watch the news, basketball games, TLC, talk shows, weather, you name it! Being able to flip through channels on your own, and not having to share monitors was cool..plus it makes for good personal entertainment and makes the flight seem shorter! Another cool thing I liked was their visual flight status, which shows the speed of the plane and current altitude. It shows a map of the U.S., w/ a picture of where the plane is during flight. Definitely useful information for passengers. I don't fly too often, so this may be nothing to frequent flyers. But another cool thing I appreciated was that they gave me a whole can of soda! Usually on most flights, they'll serve you a small cup of ice, and fill it up...splitting the rest of the can w/ others. It was nice to be given a whole can! Another plus of JetBlue is that you are given a selection of snacks to choose from (i.e. chips, chocolate chip cookies, crackers, nuts, etc.)! Not just peanuts! The flight attendants were super nice, too! Very friendly, and it appeared they enjoyed working for JetBlue. They even passed out hot towels to the passengers. What really topped of the flight, was when they announced that you get to keep the head phones as a souviner of flying JetBlue! I was impressed! They're not super great headphones, but they do work! I kept mine. They're blue. I love flying JetBlue! I would recommend flying JetBlue over any other.

Cache Creek On Saturday, I went to Cache Creek with my mom. We were supposed to go to Reno, but ended up going here instead. I didn't mind, since it was a closer drive for me. For the first time, I actually didn't gamble, because of my trip to NY on Wednesday...and losing my NY spending money was not an option! I did see my grandparents there, and they gave me $20 to play. I decided to keep it instead, so I came home $20 richer! My mom won, too! Cache Creek is in the process of building new things, such as a new hotel, an 18 hole golf course, more parking space, and another brand new casino to double its current size! Vacaville Outlets On the way home, we passed by the Vacaville Outlets. Oh boy, I love outlets! I bought myself a new pair of casual shoes! I love finding good deals, esp. named brand items for cheap! We were only there for 3 hours, which is not long enough to spend at outlets! Outlet shopping is definitely a full day's activity, not a few hours. Sunday Mass Went to Church at St. Anne's w/ my family on Sunday. We got there late, 12:05pm, and had to stand in the back. My family can never get to Church early, no matter how much I try, rushing them, or making everyone get ready earlier...we're always late! Filipino time is definitely frustrating at times! Rude or Acceptable? Is it rude to get change from the donation basket? I saw someone do that today. Dropped in a twenty, and took a ten. I didn't mind it since they were still giving a donation. Plus I think I actually did that once. All Star Game Great game! Going into double over time was exciting. I'm glad the West won! Smell of Fresh Grass That's how I smell because I cut the front lawn today! I actually enjoying pushing the lawn mower around and inhaling the scent of fresh cut grass. My favorite part is starting up the lawn mover...pulling that motor cord to start the engine! I love it when I get it started on the first pull, and hearing the engine go. My family finally got a gas powered mover when we moved to Union City. We used to have an electric one back in DC, and I hated mowing the lawn back then. It required dragging an extension cord around, which was a pain...and I actually mowed over the cord once. And our old mower spit out the grass to the side as it cut, which required raking! If you get a lawn mower, get a gas powered one. I guess the same goes for RC cars, I hear. Hmmm..I guess I'll never get an electric vehicle. New York! I'm looking forward to my trip on Wednesday. I fly back Sunday night, but since Olivia has a holiday on Monday, I'm going to check if I can stay an extra day and extend my flight! I hope it doesn't cost too much to do so.

My Computer Crashed When I got home from NY, and turned on my computer...well, it just wouldn't boot up. I usually leave my computer on all the time, so I'm not sure if someone did something to it while I was gone, or a virus crept in and wiped it out! What really sucks is that most of the files I have on the drive aren't backed up. Files I am concerned about are all the pictures I've taken. Priceless items. I've been thinking of getting a new computer, so I guess now would be a good time to start looking around. But I need to figure out a way to salvage my files. New York Pictures Since the trip, I haven't been able to upload the pics Olivia and I took. Olivia was kind enough to upload them to my server. Thanks O! urlLink Check them out!

Great Weekend in NY I had a great weekend. For 4 days, I visited my girlfriend in New York for the Valentine’s holiday! I arrived on Thursday, and left Sunday night. While I was there, Olivia and I spent some good quality time together, hanging out, discovering new places to eat in N.Y, walking around, taking pictures, holding hands in the cold, watching musicals, and riding the subway! Musical Weekend 3 Musicals in a row. We watched Cabaret, starring Neil Patrick Harris, former star of Doogie Houser M.D. He did an excellent job performing his character, something you wouldn’t expect out of him. Also in the show was the father in Happy Days, Tom Bosley. We then watched Lea Salonga perform in The Flower Drum Song. She did a good job, and sang very well. This show reminded me of PCN, the singing and dancing, the transitions between scenes, and especially the whole theme of remembering and embracing our culture. We also got a chance to watch Chicago, starring Kevin Richardson of the Back Street Boys. Olivia watched the show already, but was dying to watch him perform. I thought he was ok. The show was pretty cool…but of the 3 shows we watched, I loved Cabaret! I recommend watching this performance! Eat, Eat, Eat While in New York, we did a lot of eating. We went to a place call Dallas BBQ, which had the best baby back ribs. Located new Times Square, we ended going here because Virgil’s was a 1.5 hr wait. Virgil’s is definitely the best, but Dallas BBQ was great, for half the price! $9.99 for a full slab of baby back ribs! We also ate at this Belgian Fries place, which had some great fries! I love fries, and if I ever opened up a fast food place, it would be similar to this place. They had different sauces and dips, and we tried the Belgian Mayonnaise. Not bad! While in China Town, we ran into this cute little restaurant, with $4.50 lunch specials. I’d come here everyday for lunch if I lived in NY! The one place I wanted to go during my visit was Serendipity! I loved the movie and never got a chance to go the first time I visited. I had the Frozen Hot Chocolate, and it was delicious! I have never tasted anything like it! It was their signature dessert, and I can’t wait to have it again! Suggested by Johanna, we tried this place called Café Con Leche, a cozy Cuban restaurant. Oh boy, I had the Rabo Encendido, which is the Cuban version of Oxtail Stew. Every bite was enjoyable and tasty, I’m hungry thinking about it! Small World I did run into some familiar faces. Anne Lopez, who was a year older from SCU, happened to be at the same subway station. She was there w/ her boyfriend visiting New York, and I haven’t seen her since she graduated in 99. I also saw Jason C., from USF. We saw him at the Flower Drum Song musical. He was also visiting w/ his girlfriend. Yes, it’s a small world…it amazes me sometimes how small it is. Glad to be Back Home New York is a great place, lot’s to do, great places to eat, endless shows to watch, and cheap transportation! I wouldn’t mind living there for a year or two, but I do love the Bay Area. I love California, especially the weather. In CA, you don’t need to worry about snow, and if you wanted to see snow, you simply drive to Tahoe. I did miss driving a car, too…since we took the subway or taxi to get around most of the time…or lot’s of walking. The weather was a bit cold and freezing for me, but it was fun wearing a scarf and gloves and several layers of clothing. Big Storm Luckily I left before the big storm hit. My flight home was delayed about 1.5 hrs, but I got home safely. It was my first time to see a plane get defrosted. JetBlue had these 2 large cranes, w/ power jets that sprayed down the plane to remove the heavy ice build up before take off. I had a window seat next to the wing, so I watched the whole thing. Pretty cool stuff. Both my parents stayed up till 3am watching the news and waiting for my arrival. Now that I’m back home, I do miss New York, and especially Olivia. Thanks for a great Valentine’s weekend! Can't wait to visit again in April! Hopefully it'll be warmer! =)
Please pause for a Moment of Silence Our good friend Fred Rogers, someone we all grew up with, has moved on to a better place, or should I say a better neighborhood. urlLink Article

ESP After reading Olivia's experience of having ESP, I experienced something similar today. Well, more like powerful thinking. We had a company All-Hands meeting today in the cafeteria. I sat in the 2nd row, so I had a pretty good view. While the CEO was speaking, I was just noticing the cool setup the IT personal setup for the presentation. They set up two large video projector screens, microphones and speakers all around for everyone to hear, a video camera for employees across the country to watch, several laptops for the presentations, an amplier and sound system, and all handled by this one guy. I was really impressed w/ the setup, and w/ him managing all this technical setup. And I thought to myself, "What kind of power system is he using to power all this equipment? He probably has a really good power surge protector type device to manage all these electronic devices, and the power necessary to run it all!" And then I thought, "What if he got a cheap dinky power strip that would blow a fuse during this meeting?" I swear, 10 seconds after that thought, everything turned off! The video projector screens went black, the speakers popped as it suddenly turned off, and our CEO had a surprising look on his face, wondering what happened. And I turned to the IT guy behind, flipping swithes and turning knobs trying to get everything back up. I thought to myself, "Wow, did I do this?" Either I have powerful thoughts that turn into reality, or our IT department bought some really cheap power strips.

Jayme’s 2nd Birthday Saturday was my friend Rowena’s daughter’s 2nd birthday party, in San Jose. Oh boy, did I feel old! Lot’s of little kids running around, screaming and yelling, having a good time. Jayme had an awesome birthday party, with a large inflatable slide in the front of the house, a piñata full of candy, authentic Mexican food cooked fresh on the grill, and a candy bar w/ Jayme’s picture as a thank you gift! I don’t think I ever had such a cool birthday party when I was small. The fun part of the party was when all us guys went into the inflatable slide, and started jumping around. We tried running up the slippery slide, getting some good laughs. We eventually played king of the mountain! We wrestled each other like little boys, and it reminded us that we were still young at heart. After a few rounds of king of the mountain, we all had to catch our breath, which brought us back to reality, of how old we really are. Happy Birthday Jayme! Kitchie Bowl XVIII Friday night I went to Kitchie’s 28th Birthday party at Sea Bowl in Pacifica, for some bowling fun! It was fun bowling and hanging out with all Kitchie’s friends. My first game I bowled a 76. Second game I hit 121. I was really trying to spin the ball, and almost got the hang of it! My wrist still hurts from bowling. Happy Birthday Kitchie!

My Cousin Morris I recently found out my cousin Morris from the Philippines is here in the U.S., travelling for the first time to America for a newspaper conference in Seattle. I haven't seen him since 1994, when my family last visited the P.I. Well, he finally arrived yesterday to Seattle, and we had a chance to speak briefly last night. He's here for a week, so my family is going to try to fly him to California to visit, as soon as he's done. It should be fun seeing him again, since its been almost 10 years. I remember him as a little 10 year old, and now he's a huge 20 year old. Time does fly. In August, my family on my mom's side are all planning to visit for Abby's wedding. That is one family reunion I'm looking forward, too. Abby's wedding is the first among all our cousin's on my mom's side, so it's a pretty big thing. Can't wait!
SHC Tahoe Trip 2003 Pictures Posted urlLink View the pictures taken from our highschool weekend trip to Lake Tahoe

Tahoe Weekend w/ my Highschool Friends This weekend I went on a Tahoe Trip with my highschool friends, for some snowboarding action and cabin fun! We rented out a cabin, which was pretty cool, and very close to Sierra. It was a great weekend, and I had a good time hanging out w/ my old highschool friends. It was cool getting to hang out with a few new people, too. The Drive Up So Friday night, we drove up to Tahoe. My friend George drove, so I rode w/ him, Ruby, and Charles. We left pretty late Friday evening, waited for the traffic died down, so we had a smooth drive. But the drive up was pretty fun. We just started chopping it up, gossiping about anything, catching up, playing car games, telling jokes, and sharing puzzles/riddles. The Cabin On the way there, my friend Nikki called us up, and we ended up meeting the girls near Davis, to join their caravan. It actually started to snow a little bit in the mountains, and the girls had to pull over and get some chains. Luckily George's truck was big and had some all weather tires. We got to Cabin around 11:30pm, and made some good time. When we drove up to the cabin, the driveway was full of snow! The guys had to shovel the snow out of the way, to fit the four cars. It's tough work shovelling snow, and I'm glad that I don't live in a place where this is a daily chore. The Cabin was pretty cool There were 3 rooms, 2 baths, 7 or so beds, a complete kitchen, and living area space to chill. So that night, we claimed our beds, and luckily everyone got a place to sleep. No one had to sleep on the floors. We all hung out in the cabin, having late night snacks and catching up w/ everyone. I brought the Xbox for us to play, and we ended up playing Fuzion Frenzy for hours. Everyone seemed to enjoy the game, especially playing the event, Sumo! It was Paul's favorite game, only wanted to play that all night. He was pretty good in the game, until George and I stepped in and bumped him off the edge. =) We went to sleep around 4:30am! Sierra 4 hours later, we got up and started getting ready for Sierra. We has some breakfast: waffles, cornned beef, and rice! Yum. There weren't too many people at Sierra, so the lifts went by pretty quick. The snow was not too bad, but not as good as I had hoped. Not enough fresh power the night before, so the snow was a slightly hard, but not too bad. We all started the day off together for the first run. But since everyone had different skill levels, we ended up splitting groups half way down the first trail. So throughout most of the morning, I boarded w/ George, Ruby, and Charles. We eventually caught up with the girls before lunch. Most of the girls were beginners, learning to snowboard and do basic turns. I tried teaching them how to carve, the way I learned when I took lessons - putting your front arm in front and pretending your driving technique. Denise almost had it for a while, but lost it everything she picked up speed. After lunch, we all went our seperate ways. I boarded w/ Paul, Anna, Tyson, and George. Paul, Anna, and Tyson went skiing and were all pretty good. We went towards the back of Sierra, where all the good trails were. The snow was a lot softer back there, and had longer and better runs. I actually didn't fall to many times, maybe once or twice. But I actually started to feel more confident, carving down steeper slopes and going slightly faster than what I was comfortable with. So I had a good day of boarding compared to my past trips, eating the snow. My new helmet does help me feel safer. Cabin Fun After boarding we came back to the cabin to clean up and have dinner. For dinner, we cooked sphagetti, baked some french bread, and had 6 bottles of wine. After dinner, the real fun began when we started to play some games. We started playing those puzzle type games, like Black Magic, where if you knew the answer already, others had to figure it out. We played "In my world, there are xxx, but no xxx". This was a lot of fun, and had some many good laughs! We also played games like "Who am I", where you had to guess who the person is. And "Bang, Bang, Bang, who's dead?"...where you shoot someone and figure out who's dead. It was frustrating for some that couldn't figure out the puzzles, and when they did...they were so happy! Drinking Games We also played some drinking games for fun, after dinner. We started off w/ a round of Kings Cup. This was fun, and got everyone started w/ a buzz. We used the bottles of wine Nikki got. Denise, the rookie of the game, ended up picking the last King! She had to drink the King's cup of wine, cranberry juice, and smirnoff ice. Good job Denise. We also played "Zoom Zoom, Beep Beep". Its a game where everyone is in a circle, and when its your turn, you say "zoom" in one direction. When you wanted to switch directions, you say "beep beep", and start saying "zoom" the other way. This got pretty crazy, and was so funny when someone messed up. I wish I had it on video tape, cuz we all died laughing! After that, we also played Spoons! Oh boy! Mofia!!! Then Denise taught us how to play Mofia! Oh wow, this game is awesome! It's a game very similar in concept as the TV reality show "The Mole". In the game, we draw cards, and someone is the designated "killer". With everyone's eyes closed, the killer opens their eyes, and selects a person in the group to kill. Then everyone has to figure out who in the group is the killer! This was soo much fun, and it's my new favorite game! I can't wait to teach it to my other friends, because we all had a great time playing it! Great weekend Saturday night was a lot of fun. So many games and so many laughs. I had a great time w/ everyone, and it made me realize how lucky I am to still be close w/ my highschool friends. Its always fun getting together, and enjoying each other's company, just old the good old days. Not everyone was able to come, for different reasons, but for those that did, I can see they had a good time. Its interesting seeing how our circle of friends evolve and change, and how a lot of things never change. Its also cool how we can not see each other for years, and get together for a weekend and still be close. Its also cool how we can bring in our other good friends to the group and have a good time. I wish Olivia came, because she would of had a good time. She came two years ago, and had a lot of fun. Hopefully next year we'll have another trip, and everyone can bring their significant other. Charles...you have a year to meet someone! Pictures Since my computer died last week, I can't download my pictures I took. But I'll post the pictures from the trip soon! BTW I miss my little New Yorker!

Audrey's 20th Birthday My little sis turned 20 years old yesterday! That sounds strange to me, that she's finally in her twenties. Being as tiny as she currently is, she doesn't look like a twenty year old. One would guess 15 or 16 years old, since she's really short. It seems people are getting smaller and smaller these days. Don't know if it's the water were drinking, the food we eat, or if it's genetic. Well, at least my cousin Morris is having no problem growing! =) Emmy's Chinese Restaurant We celebrated by taking her to our family favorite Chinese Restaurant, Emmy's in San Francisco. We had a nice dinner with the family, including Mike, Ben, Olivia, and Morris. Morris was finally able to meet Ben and Olivia before he left. From visiting my website and seeing all the pictures, Morris told me that he felt like he knew Mike, Olivia, and Ben already. The power of the Internet. I haven't had Chinese in a long time! We ordered Wor Wonton Soup, Shrimp Fried Rice, Mongolian Beef, Moshu Port, Roast Duck, Beef Chow Mein, and my favorite Walnut Shrimp! I'm hungry again thinking about it. Morris's Trip Finally Ends Well, my cousin Morris also left last night, and headed back home to P.I. 6 days in California went by in a flash! Morris plans on visiting us again, possibly after college. Can't wait Morris! Hope you had a good time while you were here! Post the pictures from your camera online, please! Typical Airport Experience After dinner, we dropped Morris off to the airport, and waited with him for a while. When he checked in his balikbayan box and luggage, they were way too heavy! All the clothes, pasalubongs, and canned goods exceeded the 70lb limit. So as every typical trip to the International Airport in my experience, we had to step to the side, untie the rope, cut through the tape, open up the balikbayan box, remove the additional 30lbs over the limit, decide what to take and leave behind, and creatively repack the box! Every single time, this happens! Actually, it was pretty funny. As much as Morris wanted to bring everything back home for everyone, he had to sacrifice a quite a few things. We felt bad, so we made him wear some of the clothes and t-shirts, just so he could take them back home! So he wore several layers of t-shirts, 1 vest, several pairs of socks, 4 layers of pants, 3 hats, 2 briefs, 2 jackets, and 8 panties! Hahaha! I'm not sure if I took a picture, but it was a sight to see! I was amazed at how much clothing 1 person can wear! =) LOL!!!! Yes, I repeat, 6 panties! (pronounced pan-teees) It was cold that night, but I can only imagine how he'll feel when he gets to the Philippines! HOT! He must of put on at least an additional 20 lbs of clothing. Olivia is Back! Olivia arrived back last night, too! She was able to come join us for Audrey's birthday, and to meet my cousin Morris. She also came along to the airport to drop him off! I'm glad she's back for Spring break! Welcome back home Olivia! It should be a fun week while she's back!

Olivia Arrives Tomorrow My girl friend is flying back home tomorrow for her Spring Break! I'm excited to see her, since it's been a month since I last saw her. I can't wait!!!! She'll be back for a week and a half! We have a Winter Madess Tahoe Weekend to go to. We'll also attend her coworker's wedding! More importantly, we'll be able to spend some time together! Yeah!

San Francisco Night Life Last night, I gave a Morris a taste of the night life in San Francisco. Along w/ Mike and my friends Rex and Gell, we took Morris around the City, to show him a good time. We started off by having some cheesesteak sandwiches at this place in S.F. We then walked around the Broadway area, giving Morris some eye-candy. Morris was able to experience some fun stuff. Ask Morris for details. =) Golden State Warriors vs Phoenix Suns Last Tuesday night, I treated Morris to his first NBA game LIVE. An exciting match up between the urlLink Golden State Warriors and Phoenix Suns, these two teams are fighting for the last spot in the Western Conference playoffs. The Warriors, 1 of 3 teams to average more than 100 points/game, proved themselves worthy of a playoff spot by beating the Suns 113 to 98. With their exciting offensive style, the Warriors dominated the Suns throughout the night. I think Morris enjoyed watching the game, seeing the Warrior’s run and gun offensive style. Lot’s of great plays, slam dunks, fast breaks, screaming and yelling, and tiny Early Boykins w/ his spectacular plays. At the end of the game, Morris and I met Thunder, the team mascot. We also got a chance to watch a close up interview of Adonal Foyle, who earned a career high of 20 rebounds. Great game! We got also free chalupas from Taco Bell, for the Warriors scoring over 100 pts. Summer ^^ I found out about my cousin Veena’s urlLink website from Morris. I spent some time last night checking it out! Nice site Veena!

San Francisco Tour Monday was a big urlLink San Francisco Tour Day ! I decided to take some PTO from work, to tour Morris around the City! Along w/ Abby, Mike, and my mom, we took Morris around San Francisco's most popular tourist spots. First stop of the tour - the world famous Golden Gate Bridge! We decided to walk across the bridge, but only half way, which was pretty fun. Despite the thick fog covering most of the bridge, we took a few good shots on it and the surrounding bay. 2nd Stop was Lombard Street, the Crookedest Street in the World! We drove through and took some pictures. We then drove down to the Palace of Fine Arts, and walked around. We took more urlLink pics. That lead us to Fisherman's Wharf, where we walked around and did more site seeing. We walked to Pier 39, where we had lunch, bought some souvenirs, watched and smelled the sea-lions, took more urlLink pictures ! Morris wanted to see the home of the San Francisco Giants, so we drove down the Embarcadero and pulled over to Pac Bell Park. Mike said there's usually free entrance during the day, to tour the park. Unfortunately it was only on Thurs-Sundays. We did walk around the entire park, and yes...took more pictures! After a long day of walking, we called it quits, and headed back to Daly City. We relaxed and played some PS2. I then took Morris to the infamous, Serramonte Shopping Center..aka "Serramanila!" Morris Arrives Sunday evening, my cousin Morris from the Philippines finally arrived to California for the first time! I picked him up from Oakland Airport, and when we arrived at the house, my parents were surprised to see how much he had grown! We gave him a tour of the house, and had a nice dinner. We gambled w/ quarters, played black jack, craps, bingo! Lot's of fun! I ended up winning $6.50, mostly from my friend Rex who tried his luck playing dealer. More Running I ran with my friend Johannah after work yesterday, since she's doing the 10k run on Sunday, too. We met at Bellomy Field, Santa Clara University. Wow, it makes a big difference running with someone. Having a running partner helps push you past what you think your limit is. We ran about 3 miles, which isn't too bad considering how bad I am at running. We ran, than walked, and ran again...which will be our strategy on Sunday. It's actually starting to feel good running now. Gotta get that heart of mine pumping again. I now weigh ~170-175lbs, so it would be nice to get back to my prime weight of 165lbs. Half Court Basketball I'm playing basketball again today with my coworkers. Since it's now brighter after work, we play every Thursdays after work. We usually play half court, since there's only 1 court and about 20 people. I don't mind, because its tough work running up and down the court. But it's good exercise. My Wrist Hurts - time for Katinko! Ever since bowling for Kitchie's birthday last month, my wrist has never been the same. It was sore after bowling, and I don't think it ever healed properly. Now it just hurts. Maybe tonight I'll put some Katinko that Olivia's mom gave me. She uses it for everything! It's the "All-Purpose, Heal-All Aches and Pains, Cure-All medicine" at you apply on any wounds. It works like a miracle.

Xbox Night Last night I finally got a chance to play some of the new Xbox games I bought. Last week I went on a game buying spree, buying a dozen games. DOA Volleyball is fun, I finished a whole 2-weeks vacation with the same partner Lisa. She actually played with me the entire 2 weeks, because I kept giving gifts. First time I played, none of the girls wanted to partner up. DOABV is such a great game! Wonderful Eye-Candy. Running I ran about 2 miles last night, and I really don't enjoy running. It's tough when you're out of shape, and you're heart isn't cooperating. I'm told that it should get easier if I run routinely, but when you don't have any motivation, it's hard. But since there's a 10k (6.2 mile) marathon in San Jose this coming Sunday, I need to at least run a little before the big day. My goal is to finish in 2 hours!

San Jose Mercury 10k Today I ran the urlLink San Jose Mercury 10k . With my friends urlLink Dale , urlLink George , urlLink Joel , urlLink Johannah , and urlLink Rex we ran for 6.2 miles through the streets of downtown San Jose. About ~8000+ runners/walkers participated, and the sun shined creating lot's of excitement. We all had fun, and did pretty well! Race Results Here are the stats taken from urlLink www.RunRaceResults.com . Name Age/Sex Bib# Race Time Place Pace/mile Claudale Corpus 24-M 1867 10k 47:24 279/2304 7:38 George Carino 24-M 2118 10k 49:19 378/2304 7:56 Joel Ellazar 24-M 2307 10k 54:06 743/2304 8:42 Alan Abar 25-M 2188 10k 1:05:06 1606/2304 10:29 Johannah Portacio 25-F 2257 10k 1:07:01 1718/2304 10:47 Rex Isaguirre 24-M DNF due to Heat Stroke Dale, the best runner of the group, did very well! He placed 279 out of 2304 10k runners, pacing 7:38 min/mile. George ran strong, beating the 8 min/mile pace with 7:56. Joel ran a pace of 8:42, Johannah a 10:47 pace, and myself a 10:29. We were all happy with our results. Post Race Freebies After the race, we decided to meet by the food booths, to help ourselves to the free food and drinks. Wow, lot's of delicious samples for the runners: locks and bagel, gourmet sausages, chicken, chips and salsa, apples, bananas, energy bars, bread, milk, blended drinks, water, and a great new fitness water called "Propel"! Oh boy, did we all stock up on this drink. It's pretty good! They passed out plastic bags, and all the guys decided to take a few Propel drinks home. I think we brought home a dozen each. Lost 4 lbs. I probably lost about 3-4 lbs. from the race, but gained it right back with all the free food! Where's Rex? We were all enjoying the free food, except for Rex. For the longest time after the race, we looked around for our tall dark bald-headed Filipino friend, but couldn't find him. We waited at our designated meeting spot, but for some reason, Rex never showed up. We guessed that he got lost along the path, sprained an ankle, possibly met a girl, or got kidnapped. So carrying our plastic bags of free Propel, we decided to check the car to see if he was there. No where to be found At the parking garage, he was no where to be found! We couldn't call him, since he left all his stuff in the car, so we left him a message on the car. "Rex, give us a call!" George left him 2 quarters, and we decided to start the manhunt for our lost runner. Being the good friends we are, we decided to retrace the entire 10k path that we just ran, yell out "Rex? Rex! Rex?!?", hoping that we'd find him along the way. It was either that or go back for more free Propel. OH BOY!!! We decided Rex could wait, and went back for more Propel. =) Actually, we went back to talk to the Medical personnel on site, to see if he was there. Dale went up to a medic, saying that one of our friends is missing. The first thing the lady says is "Are you looking for Rex?" Apparently he suffered from a heat stroke, collapsed during the run, and was rushed to the Emergency Room in an ambulance. We were surprised and shocked, and wondered if he was ok. She assured us he was ok, and his body could be found at San Jose Mercury Medical Center down the street. Emergency Room So we rushed over to the Emergency Room. When we got there, Dale walked up to the front desk and said we were looking for our friend. The first name the nurse said was "Rex?" How funny she said that, because the EMT said that too. He must have been a special case or something, since they remembered his name so quickly. We got a chance to visit Rex in the Emergency Room, with tubes and IVs connected to his veins. But he was ok. Rex is a tough guy. According to Johannah, Rex is now officially a "Princess!" I took some pictures of the whole ordeal, but we were all glad he was ok. We learned that he was 1 of 2 people that got injured during the 10k. The other person was next to Rex in the same room. During my conversation with Rex about when he collapse, I over heard her say "At least I finished the race!" Unfortunately, Rex didn't finish the race, but he'll live another day to enter another one. Glad you're ok Princess. My Results I was happy with my results, and I really did push myself to finish as fast as I could. 1hr, 5 mins isn't too bad. My goal now is to do a 10k in less than an hour. We're all planning to do the Bay to Breakers, San Francisco in May. So I have a whole month to train! As much as I hate running, it's starting to grow on me.

Bananas and Peanut Butter! I usually don't eat breakfast in the morning. Yesterday, I brought a jar of peanut butter and bread to work for breakfast. I made myself a few peanut butter sandwiches, which reminded me of my elementary days of homemade sandwiches. It's been years since I last had one. Yummy! This morning I was rushing to work again, and I grabbed 4 bananas for breakfast. Since I had half a jar of peanut butter in my cube, and 4 bananas, I finally tried eating them together. I've heard that bananas and peanut butter go well together, and yes...they do! It tastes good! 2 bananas and 1/4 of a jar of peanut butter to go! Healthy!

Fishing Weekend I went fishing for the 1st time at urlLink San Pablo Dam Reservior on Saturday. My friend urlLink Rick organized the trip, inviting some coworkers and Rex. We rented a 10 person boat, and I got a chance to drive the boat. That was the highlight of the day, since none of us got a single bite! For the whole day, we fished, hooked on our bait, casted our lines, ate, drank, listened to music, and waited for fish. Nothing. Absolutely nothing. Just hanging out, relaxing, socializing, and learning to fish was fun. It would have been nicer if one of us caught something. What We did Wrong After returning the boat, we found out that we were using the wrong lines. Our lines were too heavy and thick, allowing the fish to see them easily. Our bait should have been floating closer to the surface, since the fish here like to come up and bite the bait from under them. We should of used some floating device to keep our bait floating...since most of us let is sink deeper. Oh well, maybe next time.

The best times in life, at least in my own, are those spent with people you care about, like family and friends. I find myself the happiest, when surrounded by people I love, and I cherish these seemingly normal times with family and friends. Birthday parties, dinners, holidays, Xmas, going to church, weddings, barbecues, having lunch, riding in the same car, laughing, joking around, or just simply sitting in front of the television, together. These are special times for me. These days, time seems to fly by so fast, that it's hard to keep up. People grow old so fast, friends getting married at an alarming rate, people having babies, and babies I once knew are turning into kids, kids are turning into adults, and adults turning into grandparents. I look at my parents, and I start to see the years catching up to them. Their hair is turning gray, skin starting to show wrinkles, their muscles ache from working so hard. They eat, watch television, and sleep as a daily routine, and they're starting to call me by my sisters' names. "Abigail, Audrey....I mean Alan!" I can only laugh at how old age is starting to take over. My dad is looking forward to his retirement, and for some grandchildren to take care of. But seeing my parents laugh, smile, and happy are truly priceless moments for me. Can you believe my little sister is already finishing up her 2nd year of college!?! She will be a junior next year, turning 21! I remember the days in Elementary school, when we would take the bus home together and I would hold her hand. She was a tiny kindergartner. One time, I accidentally left her on the bus as I stepped out at our bus stop. She didn't follow behind me because she fell asleep. I panicked, and I had to chase after the bus for a couple of blocks! She eventually got off at the next stop. That was the scariest moment of my life! The thought of leaving your 4 year old sister on a bus alone, is not a thought you want! But now, she's all grown up, doing her own thing. She's going to be an RA next year, in the same dorm I was an RA. Despite her denials, sometimes I think she's following in my footsteps! jk =) But seeing her doing all these things today, makes me feel old, yet proud. Speaking of old! My older sister is getting married! At the age of 26, she's going to be the first in our family to tie the knot, and we're all so excited for her big day w/ mike. I remember those good old days, fighting and pulling each other's hair, and making fun of each other non-stop. Seems like only yesterday we at OLPH, wearing green uniforms. Those were the good old days. Now, she's about to get married to the guy of her dreams, and will soon start her own family. My girlfriend lives in New York, attending school at Columbia. I cherish the times when she’s back in the Bay Area, visiting for special occasions. It’s tough having a long distance relationship, and not being able to see your significant other whenever you want. But it’s not bad at all when you know your love is real and it’s being returned. I miss Olivia and I do cherish every moment I can when spend when she’s around. It's exciting times for my family right now, so much going on, and way too fast! I’m realizing that right now is when I should pay close attention to these special occasions. Lot’s of thing happen so fast, that we have to enjoy every moment! Only later, do we realize that these normal moments today, are rare and come once in a lifetime.
