Camp Pendleton Mud Run – San Diego Weekend I had a fabulous weekend! My good friends and I flew down to San Diego for Camp Pendleton’s annual Mud Run Event! “10 Kilometers (6.2 mi.) of Rugged Terrain, Slippery Mud Walls, Straw Obstacles, Knee to Waist-Deep water & Slimy Mud Pits!” Definitely a challenging course, but lot’s of fun! Our team (George, Rex, Dale, and Joel) finished in 1hr 21 minutes. No too bad, we were happy with our time. This is officially our annual event! Tijuana, Mexico A trip to San Diego isn’t complete without a visit to Tijuana, Mexico. After the race, we decided to cross the borders in Mexico, and check out the town. Despite it being a Sunday night, we had a good time walking around and hanging out at the local bars / restaurants. Priceless Moments I just had a great weekend getaway with the guys. So many great moments through the trip, and tons of great laughs. From making underwater animal sounds in the pool, to “I need a friendster, b!tch…Dale is a Friendster B!tch”, to George being called “Baby Baby”, Dale speaking Spanish to the ladies, to Sandie, yes Sandie…for giving us the time of day, to crossing the border to Tijuana Mexico, to the whistle dude feeding us shots at El Torito, to the Boom Boom room we never went into, to Sakee Sakee or Fakee Fakee, to bargaining for cheaper beer, to attacking Rex w/ pillows while he slept, to sharing deep secrets at night, to getting stuff off our chest, like the “I like you” secrets that never came out, to wrapping duct tape around our shoes, to farting it up in the car, turning up the heat, and locking the windows (i.e. training for heat stroke), to sticking paper to our foreheads, to paying tips for using the bathrooms, for the 10 beer buckets, to good chips/salsa, to the San Diego County Fair, trying the free rock climbing, to parking miles away to avoid paying $7 for parking, to singing in the car, “When it comes to feeling…gots to hold down!”, to Tall Midget, to waiting hours in the airport for our flight, to the magic tricks, to George and I pulling our infamous What Time is It? Trick, to stealing Dale’s burrito at La Joya, “where’s my food?”, to stealing Dale's car keys and making him check the restroom, to stealing his shoes while he slept, to Rex's “I don’t think so, buddy!”, to placing 19th place at the Camp Pendleton mud run, to the Mustang vs Cavalier rental car debate(we should of got the mustang), to the outlet shopping, to tasting the mud, to free continental breakfast, to mud pits and suicide hills, to the moving the car while Dale checked into the hotel, to the roller coast rides like STORM, to all the H2s on the road, to the synchronized swimming and holding our breath under water, to Poinsetta! and to more good times to come! urlLink Check out the pictures!

SF Giants Game tonight! Dale got an extra ticket to the Giants game tonight, so I'm looking forward to watching them play. I'm hoping SF will get another win against the Colorado Rockies. First Softball Game Victory Our team "SHTZ N' GIGZ" defeated Solid Rock in a 17-10 victory, at Twin Creeks yesterday. Great victory, and everyone played really well! Good defense and offense all around. Unfortunately, after the second inning, I pulled my right hamstring when running hard to first. Right when I stepped on the bag, my leg didn't feel right, and started to tighten up. It sucked, but luckily we had more than enough players, and Brian subbed in for the rest of the game. At the end of the game, we shook hands with the other team. One of guys on the other team said to his teammate, "Good game, it's just the 1st game of the season." Darren said "Good game, it's just the 1st game of our lives!"

Crazy Weekend in Vegas! This past weekend, I hung out in Vegas for Mike's Bachelor party! For the past 4 days, I had about 10-12 hours of sleep, since we got back every morning around 6-7am! Pretty crazy weekend, and when I got home yesterday, I was beat! The Worldmarks We stayed at a timeshare called “The Worldmarks, by Trendwest” that Mike’s family had. The condo was cool, complete w/ facilities, washer and dryer, kitchen, stove, bbq grill, 2 bedrooms, 2 full baths. They had a game room w/ ping pong, foosball, video arcades, pool tables. The swimming area had a lazy pool, which was fun! Nonstop Clubbing We all had a good time in Vegas, especially Mike since he was the Bachelor. We went clubbing every night! Thursday night, we checked out The Light in the Bellagio. That place was pretty cool. Friday, we hit up Rain, in Palms. This club was tight! I had the most fun here. They had fire blown above the dance floor. We also hooked up with another bachelorette party, so they hung out w/ our group the entire night. Saturday night, we partied at Studio 54! And Sunday night, we checked out OPM. Lot's of drinking and staying up late these past 4 days! Mike’s Family I got a chance to meet a lot of Mike's family. He has a lot of cool cousins, and I got a chance to hang out and get to know some of them. We even visited his aunt’s house, had lunch, and gambled w/ his uncles! His family are all pretty close, and it was fun spending the weekend with them all. The Strippers The only thing that sucked this weekend was the strippers we got for Mike. They practically suckered us into paying them so much money, for doing nothing. All they did was made Mike remove his clothes, tied a belt around his neck to walk him like a dog, made him bark at the pussy cat, and slapped him in the butt. Everyone was pretty disappointment, but oh well...what could you do. Overall, it was a fun weekend! I didn't take too many pictures of the trip, but I'll post up what I took later on! Congrats again Mike, my future brother-in-law!

Softball Scrimmage Last Tuesday, our team played a scrimmage game against Rita's coworkers at Encinal Park. We took an early lead w/ 3 runs, only to fall behind in the next few innings. In the last inning, we were able to tie the game w/ George hitting a homerun. But in the bottom of the last inning, the first batter hit one deep and ran all the way for the winning run. Tough game, our first taste of defeat. Well, the scrimmage was good practice, and our next real game is next Tuesday. BBQ on Sunday Our GYGO4 BBQ is on sunday, so I did some errands yesterday. Bought a bunch of supplies, food, drinks, and equipment. Started planning the games for this year, which should be fun! Games include....well, that'll be a surprise until sunday. Go Giants I love the Giants! 10 games in the lead, wow! Olivia's Back for the Weekend Yes, Olivia flies in from NY tonight! She's back for 4 days, since a lot of stuff is going on. Her Lola's birthday on Saturday, Abby's Bridal Shower on Saturday, our annual GYGO4 BBQ on Sunday, and hanging out w/ her boyfriend from Friday - Tuesday! It should be a fun weekend if I don't have to come in to work!

Aids Walk Yesterday, I participated in the San Francisco Aids Walk 2003, held at Golden Gate Park. I got my little sister and Ben to walk with me, and they had a good time. We joined the Covad Team, since that’s where I work. Tons of people were there, supporting the cure for Aids, which is always positive to see. It shows plenty of hope exsit, that someday a cure will be found, and Aids will be no more. Hopefully soon! I saw a few familiar faces, like Johannah and Christina, and a bunch of Olivia’s Berkeley friends. Plenty of sponsors donated free food, snacks, and drinks…so I ate a bunch of free chips, nutrition bars, candy, bananas, ice cream, prunes, etc. We even brought a bag of goodies home. =) I parked about 3 miles away from the starting line, which really sucked. We ended up walking about 12 miles that entire day, and when I got home, my feet were sore! They still hurt right now! Pictures to be posted soon!

Six Flags Marine World Saturday, I went to Vallejo to check out Six Flags Marine World. Dale, Lisa, Darren, Stacy, Rex, Audrey, and Ben came along with me. I fortunately got some cheap tickets from Olivia's mom's work, Bechtel, who had their company picnic there. So I invited them along. We were able to get free lunch, too! =) Of all the rides there, the Medusa was the best ride! I savored every twist and turn of the ride, which started with a huge drop in the beginning. We actually went twice on this ride since it was so good. That is now officially my favorite rollercoaster of all time!If you ever get a chance, try this ride! I would go back to Marine World just to ride this ride all day long! =) Pictures should be posted up soon!

GYGO4 Olivia and I threw our 4th Annual bbq / picnic, "Get Your Grub On", at Coyote Point Park in San Mateo. Great turn out this year, GYGO4 brought together approximately 60 friends and family throughout the day. The weather was beautiful w/ the sun shining bright, and a cool breeze from the beach. Great Sunday for bbq! The Grub We had a lot of grubbin' food this year, and a lot of left over food! We served some bbq chicken, pork spare ribs, seasoned corn, Olivia's famous pasta, polish dogs, chili dogs, chips and fresh salsa, spinach dip and bread. Many were kind enough to bring food and drinks to share w/ others, such as Poppyes Chicken, Spring Rolls, Macaroni Salad, Chocolate Cake, Corn, Chips, Cookies, and lot's of BEER! So thanks again to everyone for kindly bringing some grubbin' stuff! The Competitions As part of our GYGO events, there's competitions! Organized Picnic type games, where teams compete for the most points! Lot's of participants in the games this year, six teams of six competed in this year's competitions. Definitely some surprising results at the end of the games. Last's year's champs came in last! Games this year included the following: 1) Scavenger Hunt - search for a list of items (w/ bonus items) 2) Three Point SHOE-Out Contest - shot your shoes in the bucket for points 3) "Dude, where's my shoes?" Relay Race - first team to put their shoes on wins 4) Classic Waterballoon Toss - toss waterballoon back n forth until it pops 5) Wet T-Shirt Contest (waterballoon bonus round) - oh boy! had to be there! 6) Water Sponge Relay Race - team to collect the most water wins 7) Water Balloon Volleyball Competition - volleyball w/ waterballoons We threw in some new games, and definitely kept some good classic favorites from the past. The Teams 6 teams this year, with a lost of subs and extras. Teams included: 1) No Thank You (Audrey, Ben, Will, Katie, Jessica, Nate) 2) Still Coming Up with a Name (Justin, Viet, Alan Yu, Willy, Tommy, Teh-shan) 3) Gaylord Focker (Darren, Stacy, George, Rex, Jon, Johannah) 4) EONS (Kitchie, Damon, Heidi, Jason, Jenny, Ed, Bernadette) 5) The Extras (Kevin, Tanya, Audrey, Neelish, Mike, Brian) 6) Call Me Up When There's A BBQ (Abby, Mike, Jeff, Raj, Sang, Rheo) The Champions of GYGO4 The winning team this year, collecting the most points was "No Thank You!", with the grand prize of a cool Lunch Bag Cooler! First time GYGO winners , they were shocked they won! Congrats to the GYGO4 Champions! Thanks Everyone! Olivia and I would like to thank all those who attended our annual event! Special thanks again to everyone who brought some food, goodies, and drinks to share w/ everyone...you're all too generous! Thanks again to our family for coming out to enjoy the event. And to all those who played in the competitions this year...that's what really makes the day a fun time! We feel blessed to have so many family and friends! You're all invited again next year...GYGO5! BBQ Pictures With 2 cameras, we captured a ton of pictures! Pictures will be posted up soon!

Abigail's Bridal Shower Saturday, Abby had a bridal shower at the house, and invited all her female girlfriends and family. Audrey and my mom were the hosts, and I was assigned to do manual labor...so I was able to attend this all-female event. =) I helped by setting up the house, running errands, buying food, preparing the dishes, chopping up vegetables and meat, and cooking most of the dishes. I really didn't mind all the work, since I was surrounded by so many females! =) Auds planned a lot of Bridal Shower games, which everyone seemed to enjoy. Now I know what happens at a bridal shower. They played various games, such as a toilet paper gown contest, purse scavenger hunt, how well do you know the groom, people bingo, present bingo, musical bouquet, can't say the groom's name game, how well do you know the bride...so many!! And there were tons of prizes, too. It was nice to see Auds leading the games, good qualities for being an RA this year! I took a bunch of pictures which I'll post later. By the end of the day, I was so tired! I still had to do another round of prep work for the next day, our GYGO4 BBQ!

24-22 We won our 3rd Softball Game yesterday, 24-22. Yeah! We're 2-1 now, which is not bad. Last night we only played 4 innings, since it was such a high scoring game. I went 3 for 4, with a few RBIs. But dangit, I missed a routine fly ball in left field. I thought I had it, but the sun and wind messed me up, and the ball broke to my left. I felt bad, but oh well...we all make mistakes. The team we played hardly swung their bats, and kept walking. The guys on their team kept taking balls, which means they automatically go to second base. It sucked, cuz that's how they ending up scoring so many runs. But in the last inning, down 18 to 22, we gave them a taste of their own medicine. We practically walked in our winning runs. Gosh, it feels good to win! We celebrated at St. John's, a burger / bar joint down the street. Stiff Neck I woke up thing morning with a stiff neck. Not sure how I got it, but I still can't turn my head till now! I read online it could be cause by several things, such as bad sleeping habits, sleeping with the windows open during the night, driving with the driver's window open (the cold can tighten up your neck muscles), bad sitting posture, improper ergonomics w/ your computer / desk, and of course stress! Well, I have all these symptoms...and now I'm paying the price! Website Down Yes, my website has been down the entire week last week. I contacted my hosts, and it appears that they replaced my files from w/ backup files. So I lost about a week's worth of updates. The GYGO pictures were losts, and some config files were not replaced properly. Hence the errors w/ my gallery of pics. Well, at least I didn't lose everything. When I find time, I'll have to update this crappy site. I'm tired of this site....I may start from scratch again!

Non-stop Softball Our team joined the Monday night league for really cheap, since Twin Creeks were short of teams. They gave us a good deal, $100 for the season, versus $650+ we paid for our Tuesday team. So last Monday we had a double header, to make up for the first week. 1st Game First game was a very close battle. The team we played were about our level, had some beginners, small asian team like us....and we should of won! They actually caught up in the last inning, and took the lead by scoring 6 runs. In the bottom of the 7th, we had a chance to win! We loaded up the bases, and got Darren to the plate with two outs. He hit a good solid hit on the ground, but the 2nd baseman made a great stop and a nice toss to second for the force out. That girl saved her team. It was kinda upsetting losing this way. We should have won, but I give the other team props for making a good rally. Their defense held us down in the end. They wanted it more than we did. We lost our first game, 13-12. Our Second Game Our second game of the night was a different story, where we played a team that won their first game 23-2. Watching their previous game, they looked like a great team, with great hitters and great defense. They started off the first inning by scoring 7 runs on us. Luckily that's the max for the first 3 innings. Slowly, we were able to chop away at their lead, by scoring some runs...2 here, 3 there, 5 here, 1 there. Eventually it added up, and we took the lead 14 - 11. Bottom of the 7th, they immediately scored 2 runs, 13-14. Luckily our defense held us up, and we ended up winning a very close game, 14-13. I love winning! =) Great Job "Master Batters"! Our Monday night team is now 1-1. Tuesday's Game We lost, 24 -13. Enough said. Our record is 2-2.

Where Have I been? I haven't blogged in weeks! Good reasons...besides the fact that I'm lazy to blog. Well, here is a recap -

Out of Town Guests This past week, we’ve had family over from the Philippines and New York, to attend the wedding. So, I’ve been playing tour guide for our guests, taking them around the Bay Area. Yesterday, we had a tour day in San Francisco. Pretty fun playing tour guide, showing them the city. Recap of our Tour - Passed by Pac Bell Park - Drove along the Embarcadero - Rode the Blue and Gold Fleet, cruise around the Bay - Saw Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz - Toured Pier 39 / Bought Souvenirs / Watch the Sea Lions - Walked Around Fisherman’s Wharf - Taste some SF famous chocolate at Ghirardelli Square - Visited the Maritime Museum - Drove down Lombard Street - Took pictures at the Palace of Fine Arts - Visited Saint Mary’s Cathedral - Drove across the Bay Bridge - Tooks tons of pictures Fun day! Back to work tomorrow!

Post Wedding Party The following day after the wedding, we threw another party at the house. Mike and Abby were able to invite their families to the house, to have lunch. They also opened all their presents! Many of their guests were generous, giving nice gifts and lots of money! Watching the gift opening made me want to have a big wedding myself! I had about 3 hrs of sleep after the wedding, since I was responsible for buying the food. About 100 people came by that day. We had bbq chicken, pork ribs, corn, hotdogs, sphagetti, lumpia, chocolate meat, etc. The next day, I was exhausted!

Mike and Abby’s Wedding August 23, 2003 my sister Abigail finally tied the knot with Mike. Let’s see, where should I begin. Well, the wedding ceremony was held at St. Ignatius Church in San Francisco, at 2:30pm. I had to meet all the groomsmen at the Ramada Inn, SSF...where a white limo awaited to drive us to the Church. St. Ignatius - Beautiful Church! It started to really hit me emotionally when we started walking up the aisle, to the entrance music, and finally watching Abby walk in, escorted by my parents...to the wedding music. It was a very special moment for me…beautiful bride and groom, beautiful music and church, and friends and family to witness the marriage. I was very happy for Mike and Abby, and I was really glad to be a part of their wedding. After the ceremony, what do Filipinos like to do? Take pictures! And that we did. We took a million shots at the Church, all sorts of combinations. Parents of the bride, parents of the groom, bride alone, wedding party, grandparents, sponsors, etc..etc. After the church, we drove to the Legion of Honor to take more pictures. The reception followed at the South San Francisco Convention Center. Their wedding was awesome, and I had a great time. 550+ guests in attendance, lot’s of family and friends from both sides. It felt like a huge family reunion, as I got to see relatives I haven’t seen in years! Olivia and Ben were the emcees, and did a great job. I helped with the slide show presentation, which a lot of people really enjoyed. It featured pictures from birth to today, as well as special footage of the actual marriage proposal, captured by Mike’s cousin Jennifer. Live music was provided by a band, and during their breaks, Ben was able to play his mixes. I had a great time dancing with Olivia! I took tons of pictures…so I’ll just let the pictures tell the rest of story. But once again, just want to say Congratulation to Mike and Abby! I love you guys both!

My Sister’s Getting Married! I took Friday off, to attend Mike and Abby’s wedding rehearsal. My oldest sister is finally getting married, and I’m so excited for her. I couldn’t be happier with the man she chose to spend the rest of her life with, Mike Calica! Mike is a great guy, and complements my sister well. Together, they make such a great couple, and I can tell that they make each other very happy. I can’t imagine my sister with anyone else! Rehearsal / Dinner So Friday, we had a run-through of the ceremony. We practiced walking in and out, where to stand and sit, went through the ceremony from beginning to end. Abby even started crying during the dress rehearsal. Tears of joy =)… Following practice, we had dinner at Yet Wah in the Diamond Heights area of San Francisco. Mike and Abby presented the wedding party and sponsors with thank you gifts, as a sign of their appreciation. I got a cool Leatherman pocket knife!

Happy 25th Birthday Olivia Today is my girlfriend's birthday! She's now 25 years old! Same age as me. I'm not sure what to get her for her birthday...maybe I'll just give her a big fat kiss. What's that worth these days? Happy Birthday Olivia!

11-12 Loss Dangit, we lost our tuesday night game. We led by 6 runs in the bottom of the 6th inning, and the other team rallied to tie the game. They ended up scoring the winning run in the bottom of the 7th, as we blew our lead! Definitely a tough loss to take, since we were in a 3 way tie for 2nd place. We should have won the game, but we couldn't stop their last minute rally. Oh well... Layoffs Today Yes, unfortunately we had another round of layoffs at work today. Despite all the wonderful things going on for our company, cost cutting initiatives means constant re-orgs, which results in layoffs. Two members of the CIS team that I work closely with, got the boot today...which shocked me. It surprised me that they were chosen, since they had great development skills. My group didn't get touched, since last round we lost 3 team members. Times are definitely tough, but fortunately I still have a job...for now. Covad has some great momemtum going on, and could possibly reach EBITA positive by the end of the year. By Q1 of next year, we could possibly reach profitability! Watch out for Covad stocks! =) I just hope I'll still have job by then. September 11th Wow, tomorrow is the 2 year anniversary of the Sept.11th terrorist attack. My thoughts and prayers go out to all those who lost their lives 2 years ago, and to their families who will be reminded of their loses tomorrow. I can only imagine how tough it would be for those who had an immediate family member or friend lose their lives. I wonder what will be on television tomorrow? More replays of footage from that day? Hopefullly not too much. We'll see.

10 Run Rule We won our monday night softball game, when the umpire ended it after we scored our 16th run. Apparently our league has a 10 run rule. If your team leads by 10 runs in the 5-7th innings, with a certain amount of time left, it's game over. We won 16-6. Go Master Batters!

Jillian's Saturday night, we celebrated Olivia's 25th Bday at Jillian's in SF. Thanks again to everyone for coming to help Olivia celebrate! She had a great time! Lot's of fun dancing and watching Olivia get a little freaky. I'll post up the pictures soon! SF Giants Game Sunday afternoon, Olivia and I watched the Giants blow a 6-3 lead. Disappointing game to watch. The magic number is still 11. Despite the loss, I'm sure the Giants will make it to the playoffs! Softball Game Tonight I have a softball game tonight at 9pm. Tahoe Weekend My high school friends and I spent this past weekend in Lake Tahoe. Every year, we usually plan a trip to Tahoe during the winter, to go snowboarding. But this time we wanted to get together w/o the snow. What's there to do in Tahoe w/no snow? Well, that's what we all said! Fortunately we kept ourselves busy doing lot's of stuff. We went swimming, took a hike toward the Lake Tahoe, hung out at the beach, went gambling in the casinos, played drinking games, xbox, tennis courts, who am i games, played mafia, took more shots, played king's cup, and took a bunch of pictures. Pretty fun weekend! Check out the pics in my gallery! Olivia plays Softball? Yes she does! She played for the first time on our monday team, since we were short of players. We placed her at second base, a pretty tough spot. I felt a little nervous for her, but she played very well. The first play of the game, was a grounder towards Olivia. She was able to stop the ball, bobbled it a bit, but was able to throw the runner out at first! Despite the ball hitting her ear, she got the out! I think she also got her first single, at her first at bat. It wasn't pretty, but she made it to first on an error. She also caught her first infield popup! Yes, I was proud of her softball abilities. Good job olivia! We lost, 9-18.

Softball Update We won our game last night, 12-23. Everyone hit the ball deep, due to the still air. I guess no wind and lot’s of heat makes the ball travel farther. Our Monday team still have a chance for the playoffs! Good job Master Batters! Here Kitty, Kitty, Kitty! Oh, we have a kitty now. Last week, as I drove up in front of the house after work, a small kitten sat in front of our garage door, chillin and hanging out. My mom said she saw the kitten there around noon when she came home, so I think it wanted to move in. Well, we felt bad for the cute kitty, and decided to give it some milk and food. It was definitely starving, as it wasn’t afraid of us at all, and jumped straight for the milk. It has a cute little meow, pleading for attention and for food. We ended up bringing the cat into the garage, where it currently lives now. We’re not sure what to do with it, since it’s just a baby. Do we let it back out in the streets, let it live in our garage, bring it to the vet, put posters up for Lost Kitty? My little sister bought some cat food at Safeway, so I guess we’re going to keep it for now. Maybe after we run out of kitty food, we’ll let it go. It’s also getting bigger, now that it's being fed!

Lisa Loeb Live Friday night, we watched urlLink Lisa Loeb in Concert, at Slims in San Francisco. Our friend Rick got 8 free tickets from a friend of his, and invited us to come along. Lisa Loeb was awesome, and has a wonderful voice. She sang a bunch of songs upon request from the crowd, which was cool, and told us stories and jokes in between. She sang some new songs in her new album, which made me want to go buy it. She's hot, too, btw! She played the guitar while she sang, and her talent really amazed me. I want to learn the guitar now! 80's Night Club Last Thursday night, Eileen invited us to an 80's Night Club, at this place called Cats, in San Francisco. They say it's the best place in SF for 80's music. When we got there, there were people dressed up in 80's outfits, wearing tight jeans, colorful outfits, stripes, pink, etc...which was different. I had a tough time dancing to the music at first, since it's so different from the way you would dance to hip-hop. NOt your typical side to side moves...it's more free and wild, with different tempos. But after a while, watching the girls dance and go crazy, I was able to get iinto it. Definitely a fun place to check out! Work is Tough Yes, it's kicking my butt. The environment these days at work are stressful, especially since we all talk about job security at work. So much fear of getting laid off, and everyone wondering when the next round will be, definitely frustates me. I really do not want to get laid off, especially since our company is doing so well. But unfortunately, the Engineering Department is way over budget, and our VP has a mandate to cut costs dramatically. He's actually in India right now, working with outsourcing companies, seeing what deals and services they can provide. So far, the forcasts do show a good percentage of our work will be outsourced to Inia. Outsourcing really bites, especially when work that should be given to US citizens, are being given to other countries. That seems to be the trend companies are taking these days. It does make good economic sense for a business...cheaper labor for better quality work. Why pau someone $40/hr when you can pay $10 elsewhere! I don't want to get laid off! Not sure what I would do if it happens to me again. I would go back to school, receive unemployment, do some travelling around the world, fix my room, take bartending classes, work on a side business, work out more, landscape the backyard, and hang out with Olivia. =)

Jaylin's Dedication We attended our friend Rowena's daughter Jaylin's dedication ceremony this past Sunday. It was basically a baptism for Christians. That was my first time to attend a Christian church and participate in their prayer / mass. I must say it was very different from the traditional Catholic church. Lot's of singing, live music, welcoming people, less systematic, more open, interactive, and more modern. A live band played guitars and sang live, they had a video projector and used powerpoint to show the words of the songs, and the minister gave a good speech/lesson on temptations. One thing I really liked was how they got all the children involved. The minister called all the kids to the front, had them sit in front of him, and told them a story. It was like story time, sharing a parable, simple for the kids and adults to understand. Afterwards, they brought them to some room for them to learn more lessons of life. Now that impressed me. Definitely a new experience. I sort of felt out of place, since I didn't know what to expect. It also felt like I was betraying the Catholic Church, for participating in this different method of worship. Olivia and I didn't partake in the bread and wine ceremony, somewhat similar to the Catholic Church. I just didn't feel right...almost sinful. Overall, their worship was uplifting, and gave me a more positive outlook on life. Well, after the reception at Jay's sister's house, we went to St. Anne's Church. I felt more at ease and appreciative of the traditional Catholic mass. I was glad that the priest gave a meaningful homily, because many times priests tend to talk on and on, losing the audience, and losing the whole meaning of the gospel. I do appreciate great prients, that know how to keep their audience attentive. Anyways. I'm Catholic, born and raised, and will always be Catholic! =) Amen. Another Loss We lost our softball game last night, 22-14. Tough loss. Lost our past 3 games. One more game next week, and maybe we'll get to the playoffs! My Bubby is Sick Yes, Olivia is sick. I hope you feel better! Get some rest and drink lot's of fluids. And stop watching your soap operas!

Train / Barenaked Ladies Concert on "The Rock!" Last night Olivia and I saw a concert of a lifetime...the urlLink Barenaked Ladies with special guest TRAIN Concert on Alcatraz Island ! T-Mobile sponsored the concert, as part of their T-Mobile All Access concert tour across the U.S. All I can say is "WOW! I'm switching to T-Mobile!" Because Olivia was caller 101 on K101.3, she won two tickets for this event! It was definitely a well organized event, and an awesome experience! FREE STUFF First of all, everything was free! When we arrived to Pier 39 to check in, they gave us a cool All Access concert badge to board the ferry to Alcatraz. Once we got onto the Rock, T-Mobile gave everyone a huge gift bag that contained a bunch of goodies! It included a black T-Mobile fleeze jacket(in case it got cold), a matching fleeze beanie(which kept my head warm), a cool baseball style t-shirt(i gave it to my mom), a keychain glow stick, an All Weather Emergency Poncho (in case it rained), and other stuff(flyers, coupons). I thought that was very generous of T-Mobile! As we walked towards the top of the Island, towards the music and stage, we could smell barbeque! We were told there would be food available on the Island, but I never thought it would be free. Well, it was! They served burgers, gourmet hotdogs, chicken kabobs, potatoes, Ceasar salad, cookies, drinks, hot chocolate...you name it! And did I mention it was FREE! I love FREE stuff, makes everything so much more exciting! T-Mobile really took care of their audience, from free goodies to free dinner to a great venue! Now that's how concerts should be thrown! Awesome Concert The Concert was awesome! Train rocked the Rock, and so did Barenaked Ladies! You can view their performance on the urlLink T-Mobile website . Evening Magazine Oh, before the concert, Evening Magazine came up to me and asked if they can interview me! I said sure!!! They asked me: Where are you from? Who are looking forward to see perform? What do you think of the venue? Have you been to Alcatraz before? Would you come back again? So I could possibly be on Evening Maganize! We'll see... Thanks for winning tickets Olivia, and for inviting me! Now can you please win a million bucks on the radio?

I think our Monday night team made it to the playoffs next week, so it's definitely cool to extend out season. Once softball is over, I'll no longer be involved with any physical activities. I guess I'll start running again, since Olivia is getting into it now! Movie Weekend Olivia and I watched two movies this weekend, which was quite a lot for me. I seldom go to the movies, just because I refuse to pay 9 bucks for a flick. I'd rather buy an Xbox game or DVD....but that's just me. Olivia loves watching movies! We watched urlLink Fighting Tempations starring Cuba Gooding and Beyonce. Good movie...but I'd suggest waiting for the DVD or buying yourself an Xbox game! We also watched urlLink Underworld starring Kate Beckingsale. I'm in love with her! Great movie, loved her performance, and I can't wait for the sequel!

Covad Moves to San Jose My company headquarters moved from Santa Clara to San Jose. With every move, there are pros and cons. PROS: + I actually save about 3 miles each way, so I definitely don't mind the shorter commute + Our new building has more space and parking + Lot's of windows all around, which makes the working atmosphere a lot brighter =) + Nicer cubes and more modern building (our old building was a former Yahoo building...everything was purple and yellow inside..yuck) + Huge water fountain in the front (it feels nice to drive up to a better looking building) + Our company saves a ton in lease payments, so that increases my odds of not getting laid off + Change is always good + More new restuarants to try, new places to eat CONS: - I'm no longer one block away from Costco (no more cheap gas or hotdogs for lunch) - My new cube is right across from my manager (i have to always be on guard) - I don't get to pass by the IKEA in EPA for free Swedish meatballs on my way home - Slightly more traffic on the way home, since I take 880 home - I miss my old cube location - Company is continuing to try to cut costs...increases my odds of getting laid off

Marine World Saturday, I went to Six Flags Marine World in Vallejo, with a bunch of friends(Olivia, Rick, Eileen, Oscar, Johanna, Rowena, Chris, Eric, and Marjorie). Marine World had a Halloween Fright Fest attraction we wanted to check out. Two years ago, we all went to Great America for Halloween, where they had a Haunted House. We got there around 4pm, and rode about 3 rides: The Medusa, The Zonga, and Kong. We also went through two haunted houses. They were ok..got scared a few times. There were a bunch of highschool cheerleaders or school camps walking around...made me feel old being at Marine World. I did feel a little old...but boy oh boy, do I love rollercoasters! Kings Afterwards, we headed to Rowena and Eric's house to play some Kings. Pretty fun stuff...I ended up picking the last king, with only two cards left. It sucked, but I had a good time. Breathalizers Johanna brought her breathalizer (spell check), which calculates your BAL. I tested 0.03, which wasn't too bad. Don't ask what Olivia got. =). Pretty cool device to have if you party a lot. I saw one in Costco for about 20 bucks, which I think I'll go ahead and buy. Go Niners! I love it when the Niners win! Go Niners!

Mad All Day Long! Yes, I was mad all day long today...furious actually. You wouldn't believe what happened to me today! Of all things that could happen, this was definitely a first....and I'm not sure why it pissed me off! Lunch With Olivia Well, this past Tuesday Olivia drove to SJ to have lunch with me, and to visit our new building. It was also our anniversary, so we celebrated by having lunch at Banana Leaf, a Malaysian restaurant in Macarthy Ranch. It's one of my favorite places for lunch...great dishes, every bite so flavorful, long waits for a table..my coworkers and I go there a lot! We ordered some classic pad thai, some spicy red curry chicken, and siam salmon! Delicious! Anyways, we had so much leftovers, I ended up taking it back to work. I decided to keep it for lunch the next day. So I did what anyone else would do...I put it in the fridge! Craving the Leftovers So on my way home after work that day, I thought about lunch, the leftovers, and wished I had taken it home for dinner! I could still smell and taste the siam salmon, and I craved that left over pad thai and curry chicken. Unfortunately, I would have to wait for the following day. Ross's Turkey Sandwich So all morning long, my taste buds definitely looked forward to the leftovers from yesterday. When lunch time hit, I walked over to the lunch room, opened up the fridge, and for some reason...I didn't see my container of leftovers. I searched each shelf of the fridge, high and low, and even checked the freezer...in case I placed it there accidentally. It was no where to be found! I panicked. I felt like Ross, in that one episode of Friends, where someone stole his Holiday Turkey Sandwich at work. I was mad, and furious that someone would do such a thing. Then I looked in the trash can right by the fridge, and saw my container... partially opened. At first I thought that it couldn't be...but I knew it was mine, because the container had the markings of the siam salmon, the red curry chicken, and pad thai I had been craving all day! I was soo mad! Someone ate my leftovers! Benefit of the Doubt At first I thought it was an accident. Maybe someone took it by mistake and ate it. But then I realized that the person must of knew it wasn't their lunch. Someone had the nerve to take someone else's food, heat it up in the microwave, bring it to their cube, open the container, see the food, and eat the red curry chicken, enjoy the deliciuos pad thai, and savor the siam salmon...and toss it in the same trash can by the fridge so the actual owner could see! Benefit of the doubt my @#$! Yes, I felt like a victim...as if someone stole something precious to me, deprived me of what rightfully belonged to me, stabbed me in the back while I wasn't looking, betrayed my trust. Someone ate my leftovers! Not sure how anyone else would have felt...but I felt a little sad, just because I was looking forward to it. That also made me feel mad...knowing that someone could do such a thing. Over reacting? Maybe I'm over reacting, and that this sort of thing happens all the time. It's only left-overs right? Wrong...it was MY leftovers! Ask Ross Gellar of Friends...."You ate my SANDWICH!!!??!!"

Spookalicious 2003 Nate and Michele threw a halloween party at their place in SF. So this year, Olivia and I dressed up for the first time in 3 years. She dressed up as "OLvira" and I was "The Count!" Pretty fun Halloween this year, seeing everyone dress up. Let's see, we had a butterfly, Batman and his parents, clark kent, a college boy with a velvet collar, Sydney Bristow, Boo-T-Licious, Roaring Ruby and The Big Cheese, Cream from some young Guy, Mr. LA Raper, and a Japanese Girl. We played some drinking games, walked around the city, checked out different bars, and saw a ton of city folks dressed up! The best costume I saw was a guy dressed as a pinata! He asked Shirley to hit him with a stick....a cool thing was candy falling out of his hat! urlLink Check out the pictures! Nick's Bachelor Party Last Saturday was also Nick's Bachelor Party! I must say that I have never been to a bachelor party like this one! Definitely one party I will never forget! Let's see...what happened that night? I bet Nick doesn't even remember himself. Well, basicially we all met up in the city, to have dinner at the Steps of Rome near Broadway. During the night, Nick apparently drank a little too much wine. I think he also has a shot or two before dinner. Well, by the time our dinner came, Nick was knocked out...and started to throw up. The guys took him outside, to get some air, but by then....the night had ended before it could begin. Nick was out of commission, and was taken home. Definitely a unique night. Unfortunately us guys failed our duty, to get Nick some booty. =) However, in the spirit of bachelor parties, some of us did continue the celebrations in Nick's honor....Deja Vu! I did capture some great shots of this memorable night...but not sure if I should post them up. Email me if you're interested!

Jewel Concert Olivia and I saw Jewel perform last night, at the Flint Center in Cupertino. Great concert! The entire concert was acoustic, so all she had on stage was a mic, her guitar, and her voice. I really enjoy unplugged type music, or acoustic versions of songs. There's just something about singers singing their song, with only the guitar accompanying their voice. The performance feels more intimate, and you can really appreciate their voice without numerous instruments or background noise to clutter their talent. Jewel has a great voice! She even sang an Italian opera song! The entire week, I listened to her new cd, to learn her new songs. So when she performed a song I recognized, it was fun singing along. There were a good # of songs I didn't recognize from old albums. Anyways, she was awesome! Very entertaining, telling lot's of jokes and personal stories. I also never realized how HOT Jewel is! =)

Crabbing at Fort Baker I spent my Sunday Crab fishing at Fort Baker, with Rex, Rick, and Evan. We had 8 crab nets for the 4 of us, which helped get some good coverage on the dock. We caught a good number of Rock Crabs, which ranged from 4 to 8 inches wide, across the shell. Not too bad! Crabbing is hard work, but I actually enjoy catching crab. It’s definitely a lot easier than fishing. Last time we went fishing, we spent the whole day and didn’t get a bite! For crabbing, all you do is throw the net over the dock, wait 5-10 minutes, and you caught some crabs! Bringing something home to cook and enjoy, makes the sore arms, dry stinky hands, and wet clothes worth while. I haven’t tried eating the crabs I brought home yet, but my parents are pretty excited about them. Hope they taste good! For starters, Olivia made some Caesar Salad. For dinner, we cooked Oven Roasted Pork Ribs, Sweet Garlic Corn, Olivia’s Famous Pasta with Hotdogs, Roasted Herb Potatoes, and Garlic Bread. For dessert, we had brownies, turon(fried bananas), and vanilla icecream. I can’t believe we fed 21 people! Thanks everyone for coming and hanging out! Pictures to come soon! They had their ceremony at the Buddhist Temple in San Jose. Reception followed at the Mayflower Restaurant in Milpitas. Congrats once again Nick and Diep! Check out the pics!

Non-Stop Holiday Parties! December is definitely my favorite time of the year! Lot's of holiday parties, gift exchanges, delicious foods, family and friends, laughs, and good times. This entire weekend was practically a non-stop holiday party with all our friends! It was definitely a fun filled weekend! Great night w/ college friends, lots of laughs, good appetizers, and plenty of gift stealing! We played the white elephant game, and I ended up with a crock pot! I love my new crock pot, and can't wait to try it out. Sorry Johannah, I know you wanted it badly! =) I'll get you one for your wedding! =) We also played a new game, which I called "The Twelve Days of Christmas - Unplugged".
