I wasn't sure how it would work, since I had it planned for my high school party. But it worked out really well. I'll post the lyrics once I get them! Creative stuff! urlLink Check out the pictures! SHC Annual Christmas Party / Gift Exchange Then on Saturday, I hosted my annual high school Xmas get together at the house. Every year my friends from Sacred Heart Cathedral have a potluck and white elephant gift exchange. We've been doing this since 1995. The night was a lot of fun, and I had a great time seeing all my high school friends again. Throughout the night, we played a bunch of games! It was cool to see everyone participate and get into it. First game we played was a rule game, where everyone got a sticker. Basically, if someone catches you breaking any of the rules, they take all your stickers! There were a lot of sneaky players (George Carino) that stole people's stickers! Whoever had the most stickers in the end won a cool prized. We then played the White Elephant game w/ $5 gag gifts. Something new Charles came up with, which was fun. We had a $5 gag gift, and a $25 nice gift, so we played the White Elephant game twice! After that, we also played the 12 Days of Christmas Unplugged, which was really funny. Here were the lyrics my high school friends came up with: On the ___ day of Christmas, my true love gave to me: First - A hot dog from Serramonte Second - 2 Penis Pumps Third - 3 French Fries Fourth - 4 Minute Blow Jobs Fifth- 5 Friendster Whores Sixth - 6 Shakka Callers Seventh - 7 Smirfs a Smoking Eighth - 8 Men a Whacking Ninth - 9 Elves Masturbating Tenth - 10 Pot Heads Smoking Eleventh - 11 Hoes a F***ing Twelfth - 12 Sonny's Pornos We also played a Xmas pictionary game, guys versus girls! This was a lot of fun. The guys won, winning a roll of Christmas wrapping paper! We also played this puzzle game, and sang Karaoke. I can't believe there were so much left-overs!!!! It was definitely nice to spend some quality time w/ old high school friends, and to see how close our circles of friends still are. A few actually stayed over till 5am in the morning! We chatted and caught up on all the gossip, reminiscing about the good old days. We even looked at old high school pictures and the year book. We were all so skinny and funny looking. Charles definitely changed the most...he had a kid and play hair cut, and was super skinny! =) urlLink Check out the pictures I Love Wine & Winter Holidays Then on Sunday, we had a holiday get together w/ our friends from Berkeley. Jane hosted this party at her new condo in Oakland. Lot's more fun, for the 3rd day in a row! We had lots of great bottles of wine, with a cool wine journal where you write down what you thought about the different wines. Lot's of great food, too! We also played the white elephant game, and I ended up with an 80's Game. Luckily Chris was kind enough to trade his gift with me. I really wanted his gift, which was 6 wine glasses/a cool wine bottle opener, and a bottle of wine). Thanks Chris for the trade, I owe you one! We then played several rounds of Taboo. Of course, guys versus girls! Guess who won? Definitely not the guys...we had to take 2 shots of Grappa, a cognac from Italy. We also played Mafia! I love this game, and I can never win at this game. We played several rounds, and the Killer was never able to win! Fun night! urlLink Check out the pictures!

Happy New Year! Wow! Goodbye 2003, hello 2004! It's finally that time of the year again, when you can start a new fresh beginning. Everything a person did or didn't do last year, for some reason can be resolved / forgiven / and improved with the new year. Yes, that is all done through new year's resolutions! Here are my top 10 resolutions for 2004! 1) Save more money / more $$ towards investment! I spent way too much money last year, and didn't save enough. Spent money on things I didn't really need, or wasted it on getting a good buzz! Ideally, I'd like to buy only things that I NEED, versus things that I WANT. I'd also like to continue to learn more about investing, and to put more money saved into various investments. Who doesn't want to retire early? 2) Exercise Regularly / be more active / watch less television Yes, I started off last year exercising and feeling good, but ended the year w/ extra weight and feeling heavy! Again, my goal is to be more active, and to exercise regularly! The only way is to get off that couch at home, go outside, and do something active! I'd like to lose 10 lbs this year, and get back to sophomore year weight of 165!! =) 3) Go to Church weekly / pray daily Last year, I missed some weeks of Church for various reasons. I'd like to make a conscious effort to go to church weekly, or at least 3 times a month! I did pray regularly last year, which I was proud off, and I shall try to continue that throughout 2004! 4) Eat healthier food / less fast food, fried foods, sweets I love KFC and anything fried! French fried, fried chicken, lumpia, fried crab wontons, fried vegetables, and anything battered and fried! Plus I love chocolate! But no, I will not give up anything fried or chocolate covered in 2004! Wowever, I will try to consume those items in less quantities and less frequently, and try to eat more fruits and vegetables instead! =) 5) Maintain friendships, old and new Friends are definitely important to me, but many I have lost touch with many throughout the years. I'd like to try to maintain the friendships I have, especially those I've lost touch with, and to try to make new ones as well throughout the year! 6) Spend more quality time with the family With everyone being so busy with work, school, having different schedules, and living their own lives, it's tough to spend quality time with my family. Usually on special occasions we get together, like birthdays or thanksgiving, or Christmas. I'd like to make an effort to spend more quality time with my parents and sisters, as much as possible and whenever possible! 7) Be more generous / less self focused I need to focus less on myself and my needs, and focus more on the needs of others. It's easy to be concerned about what I need and want, and easy to forget about the needs of the ones you love. I'd like to be more generous towards my family and friends. The old saying goes, "the more you give, the more you'll get back in return!" 8) Learn new things What have I learned this passed 2003? I don't know. My goal for 2004 is to learn something new, either a musical talent, a physical activity, or a new technology beneficial for my career! Hopefully by next year, I can say that I learned something that I am proud of. 9) Read more literature Yes, I need to read more literature, besides stock quotes, sports, and Maxim magazines! 10) Try new things! Yes, life is too short to be doing the same things over and over, because it's 'comfortable'. I'd like to try new things in 2004, like eat at different restaurants, try out new dishes I haven't tried, visit new places I've never seen, and just do things I usually wouldn't do or try! Hopefully that will open up a new perspective of the world and of life! These resolutions definitely look similar to last year's! Oh well, definitely good goals for anyone! Happy New Years! Good luck with your own personal resoluations this year!

One Year From Today! ...I will be married to Olivia! =) Yes, we booked the church for January 8, 2005! Save the date! Let the countdown of being single begin! =) That's 364 days of freedom remaining! jk

Hi Friends and Family, I just want to say a deep heart felt “Thank You!” Thanks for coming out Friday night to celebrate my 26th Birthday! That night was one of the biggest days in my life, and it truly meant the world to me to have both my family and friends, to come out and celebrate, and to witness a very special event in my life. Not only did I turn 26 that day, but I asked the love of my life to marry me! To share such a momentous milestone w/ the people Olivia and I care about, and with those that care about us, made that night truly special! Proposing to Olivia and her accepting my proposal made me the happiest guy in the world! Being able to share that once in a life time moment with you all, to witness our love for each other, really topped off the night! I want to thank all of you who came that night, for making that night a success! I remember at the beginning of the night, I felt a little nervous…typical, I assume for all guys about to propose. All these thoughts ran through my head! “What will I say?” / “What will I do?” / “Will the words come out right, or will I sound stupid?” / “Am I ready?” / “Is she ready?” And more importantly, “Will Olivia say NO?” Then I thought about how much I love Olivia, how wonderful she is, and how much she loves me…and I doubted that she would ever say no! And at that point, I started to relax, knowing that things will work out, and that we love each other so much. I started to feel more comfortable the rest of the night before the proposal. I didn’t know when the right opportunity would come, but I thought I would wait when the time was right. After we finished up dinner, and I opened my birthday gifts, I decided to give everyone a toast. I truly felt thankful for a lot of blessing in my life, that not very often do I express my thanks and gratitude. Having all the spotlight I decided to finally thank everyone for all I was grateful for! I first thanked my friends, who I am truly grateful for. I recalled a poem from elementary school, called “A Friend for Life”, which I shared with everyone. Being as old as I am, I didn’t remember the middle portion of the poem (but I will definitely try to find it). It went something like this: It’s hard to write, when you don’t have a pen. It’s hard to help, when you don’t lend a hand. We often take for granted the things in life, like laughing, crying, and the people we like. ….then I forgot the middle. But it ends something like: It’s easy to write, when you have a pen. It’s easy to help, when you do lend a hand. Do not take for granted the things in life. Because a friend indeed, is a friend for life! That poem taught me not to take for granted the things in life, especially friends! And I thanked all my friends for their friendship! I consider all of your friends for life! I also made a toast to my parents. I wanted to thank them for everything, for being pen pals in the Philippines, for falling in love, for bringing me into this world, and for loving each other for 28+ years! They have raised me to be the person I am today, the values I have, and for everything I am, I owe it to them. I also toasted my sisters, who have always been there for me. For laughing at my jokes when they weren’t funny, and for pretending my corny magic tricks were good when they were bad, for everything they have done for me! They have also made me who I am today. I wanted to thank my family, the most important people in my life! That night, I had called Olivia’s sister, to help me invite her parents to the dinner! Fortunately Olivia’s parents were able to make it, because I wanted to give a special toast to her parents, too! I thanked them for falling in love, for loving each other for 30+ years, and for bringing Olivia to this world. If it weren’t for them, I wouldn’t be as happy as I am now. And to Olivia’s sisters, for making me feel welcome to their family! I gave them all special cheers! And last but not least, I thanked God, for all his blessings. God has blessed w/ me so many blessing, and every night I thank him for everything I have. Then I think I started to ramble on, like I’m doing now in this letter. I told everyone about the first time I met Olivia. It was at Santa Clara, in my old apartment. Across the way lived some mutual friends of ours, and I happened to pass by one day she was there. Do you know when you meet someone at a party or club, and you start to stare at them…and right when their eyes turn your way, typically you would turn away or your eyes would shy away? Well, that night, when I saw Olivia, my eyes did not shy away. I wanted to absorb as much of her as possible! She has the cutest smile, and beautiful eyes, and her personality made me want to get to know her better! I knew she was special. Fortunately we got to become friends and know each other better. My fondest moment of Olivia was on December 4, 1999. We were hanging out in Berkeley one day, and we felt hungry. Being the poor hungry college students we were, we decided to grab some food at Jack in the Box. Berkeley being Berkeley, this Jack in the Box had a bullet proof window! I recalled the driving though Jack in the Box w/ the bullet proof window, and ordering my 99 cents items, and Olivia ordering her items. As we drove away, I took a huge bite of my Jumbo Jack. As I took a bite, she asked me this question: “Will you be my boyfriend?” I nearly chocked! Never before as anyone asked me that question! I don’t think any guy has ever heard that question! But then I knew that she was special! She was definitely special! Ever since then, we had a running joke. I always asked her when she was going to propose to me. She asked me to be her boyfriend, I looked forward to the day she would ask me to marry her! I decided to ask her one last time, but to let her know that no longer will I ever ask her that. That today was the day it was my turn to ask. I think at this point, she started to cry. I had my mom hold the ring throughout the night, afraid I might lose it. So I asked my mom for the ring, and got down on one knee. And the rest is history! I’d like to thank each one of you for making that night memorable, and for sharing in our joy and happiness! Yes, I’m getting sentimental, because I’m really happy! =) But really, I can’t thank you all enough! I value each of your friendship, and as the poem I recited goes, “Do not take for granted the things in life, because a friend indeed is a friend for life!” I consider you all friends for life! For those that we not able to attend that night, I have not forgotten about you! Thanks for your friendship, your happy birthdays, and sincere congratulations! I wish that all of you would have been there! I posted the pictures on my website, so check them out! Luckily we captured some of the night on video, and you’re all welcome to relive that moment! Talk to you all soon! And to my new fiancée, I love you! Sincerely, - Alan

My 26th Birthday at F&A's For my 26th birthday, Olivia organized a pretty cool birthday dinner, inviting all our good friends and family to Fanny and Alexander, in Burlingame! She made reservations at F&A's for about 30+ guests, and luckily the place only took our reservation and no other due to the large size of our party. So fortunately, our party were the only ones there for dinner! It seemed as if we had the entire place to ourselves, because the chefs practically cooked meals for our dinner alone. It felt like we had a private party, which was cool! =) I haven't been there before, and not knowing the place worried me a bit, but I was pleasantly surprised what a great place it was! I couldn't of asked for a better place for such a special night! Along with dinner came free dancing/ clubbing! Best Birthday Ever Anyways, I had such an awesome time that night! I must say that it was one of the best nights of my life! The people that I wanted there that night were there. I invited my parents, who came to celebrate. My two sisters and their significant others were there to celebrate, too! So my entire family attended that night, which really meant the world to me. I also invited Olivia's family, both her sisters and parents. Fortuantely, Olivia's parents came by to celebrate! Thank you all for coming, and especially to Kitchie for doing me a big favor! I felt happy that Olivia's family came that night, too!!! And definitely a lot of my really good friends came! That night, I knew who the important people and true friends in my life were! Those that came that night, showed me who really cared about me. My heart felt truly thankful for each person that came out that night! As a gift to all those who came, I decided to share a very very important moment in my life. I know there were a few people I wished came out that night, but couldn't for various reasons. I have not forgotten about you all, and also appreciate your sincere happy birthdays, your friendship, and your congrats! Thanks again Friends and Family! Thank you all for coming, and for sharing that special night for me! Thank you all for the great memories past and future, and for all your love and friendship! I value each one of you and our friendship we share! Really, I can't thank you all enough for coming out that night!!!! Pictures! Please check out the urlLink pictures from the very special night! Tons of pics taken. Thanks also to Ben and Audrey for capturing that night on video. More to come... Ok, enough for now...more details to come from that special night.

Wedding Planning Yes, that is what your life will revolve around when you propose to your girlfriend and get engaged! My fellow single brothers...beware! Immediately after Olivia and I got engaged, the planning for the big wedding day began! Before I knew it, we had several appointments w/ reception venues! Wow! I was really surprised when Olivia told me she had contacted numerous places and booked several appointments for us. I could of sworn I had just proposed a few hours earlier!!! =) I guess she was really excited to get started w/ the wedding planning. I bet girls are like that. They have their wedding already planned out in their heads, even prior to getting engaged. Even as little girls, I'm sure women have ideas of their perfect wedding. I know one of our good friends has her wedding already planned out in her head. I won't say any names, but you can ask Dale DeLeon who I'm talking about. :) Thanks Fiancee! I'm glad Olivia is really into that stuff, because calling places and setting up appointments definitely is not my cup of tea. Olivia enjoys getting on the phone, making calls, asking questions, so I'm actually fortunate in that arena of wedding planning! Thanks fiancee! I appreciate it! I'd like to think that all I have to do is propose and show up to the wedding! =) Only if life was that simple... Major Steps The first major step in our wedding planning roller coaster ride was deciding on a day and booking the Church immediately. DONE! Second step, which I assume is correct, is booking the reception place. That step is a little tougher than it seems. This step isn't as quick as the first one. Last weekend, Olivia and I started shopping around for possible reception places. Olivia set up a few appointments w/ some interesting locations. It's definitely overwhelming at first, but it does take a lot of planning, decision making, and calculations to find that perfect place. So many factors to consider, from how much per head, to ample parking for our guests, to the distance from the Church, to the size of the dance floor, to yes...the bathrooms! Restrooms! Critical to the Perfect Wedding One place we went to, wanted to show us their restrooms! I guess that is an important feature of possible locations...the bathrooms. To be honest, that's what I actually look for now, when we visit different locations...the restrooms! Are they clean? How many stalls? Do they have complimentary fragrance or cologne? Is there a person passing out towels that requires a tip? Are the restrooms modern or old school? Automatic flush or manual flush? That is actually a very critical component to wedding reception....something that many engaged couples over look when planning their wedding. Crucial to an exciting wedding day! Exciting Times Wedding planning is definitely fun and exciting. But it's a lot of work! I thought the hardest thing about getting married is asking the parents for their blessing and the actually proposal. You know what? That is actually the easiest part! Planning for the big day is the hard part! My Wedding Dreams I want a nice small personal wedding, with just our close family and friends. Nothing to big and extravagant like my sister's 560+ guests, where they invited all their family, extended family, friends, friends + 1 guest, etc. I wouldn't mind something very small and simple, with around 100-150 of our closest friends and family. I want to be able to talk to each of our guests, and spend time with everyone during the wedding reception. As far as the place, I want a place that is pleasant and nice, has some nice picture spots and scenery, something that is affordable for our budget, good food, good location, and an excellent restroom facility! The restrooms of the venues will be my deciding factor. 3rd Step I'll let you know what that step is when we find a reception spot w/ the high tech, state of the art restrooms!
t

Covad Winter Gala Saturday my company had it's winter gala at urlLink Hayes Mansion in San Jose. Beautiful place! I took my fiancee with me, and she got a chance to meet some of my coworkers. Actually, no one from my direct team went, but a few from software did go. Kinda sucks that my team has no spirit, and are not into events like this. But it was fun to introduce Olivia to some people from Covad. Overall, dinner was pretty good. Great appetizers, and a good selection for the buffet. They also had a live band, urlLink The Heart Beats ! Very entertaining, singing songs from the 70s-80s, like the Beatles, Village People, Elvis, Tom Jones, some motown hits, and disco, too! Not only did they perform the songs, they dressed up w/ wigs and costumes! The night was fun, and we got some possible ideas for our wedding. Reception Hunting Continues Yes, all day Saturday we continued our hunt for a reception location. We visited Santa Clara Adode Lodge, the Marriot Hotel, and David's. It's tough finding the perfect place. Places are either too small, too expensive, too far, or too many extra charges. I think our hunt continues again next weekend! Butterfly Effect My little sister got free tickets from school, so we watched it for FREE! I love free movies. Overall, I thought it was an awesome movie! Go watch it...and great ready for some thrills!

Lost All My Work Email Yes, I did! Gone, all gone! Not sure what happened exactly, and neither does our IS department, but it definitely sucks that all the email I had in my inbox are gone! What happened was that we had a presentation, and I had to log into my manager's laptop to set things up. I just happened to open up Outlook for a second, and then I just closed it. Well, after our presentation ended, which went well btw...I came back to my cube, checked my email, only to find all my email gone! Only emails sent to me since 1:19pm were available. What the heck happened! Well, the IS guy helping me couldn't figure out what happened. My emails weren't archived in any of my desktops or the laptop. I had a ton of emails w/ very important information, which I need for my job. They opened up a Ticket, #35583, and will get back to me tomorrow morning. Say "bye bye email!"

Saving Money Saving money is a tough thing to do! Especially with so many expenses to worry about, numerous events to attend, dinners and outings with friends, new gadgets and toys of interest?saving money can be a challenge! They say one great way to save is to categorize things as a "WANT" or a "NEED". Yes, it's truly a simple concept, yet so challenging for me because of the endless number of things that qualify in the "WANT" category. I WANT to buy new shoes, I WANT to go out, I WANT to travel, I WANT a new computer, I WANT this, I WANT that, I WANT WANT WANT!!! Everything I see is a want! It bites, truly it does, but it put things into perspective for me. I actually have been saving and have been sacrificing on a lot of wants, and just spending on my needs. Actually, there isn't much that I want these days. I pretty much have everything I need. Now, I actually have to save for our big day next year!

Super Bowl Sunday Sunday, I hung out w/ the Berkeley crew in Oakland, at Oscar's place. Since Jane was out of town, he decided to host the Super Bowl party at their condo. =) Before the game, we went to Rick's favorite Taco truck in Oakland, to feast on some grubbin' Mexican food. The tacos were pretty good...greasy, fried in lard, spicy, authentic tacos! Good stuff. I only had 3 tacos, while some of the other guys had 6-7! I'm trying to watch what I eat, or at least eat things in moderation. After we ate, we watched the game at Oscar's. Good game overall. Slow start, but things started to get exciting by half time. Eileen, actually won twice in her company pool. I think she won $375, with 0-4 as her numbers. Lucky girl...she promised to treat us all to tacos the next time we eat at the Taco truck! Commercials The Super Bowl commercials this year were good. My favorite was the Coors Lite commercial with the donkey with leg hair extensions...trying to be one of those Coors horses. Funny! I couldn't stop laughing. I enjoyed the half time show! =) Diep's Birthday Saturday night, Diep celebrated her 26 birthday! Nick planned a surprise birthday at his house in Saratoga. They made all kinds of sushi, so we ate that all night. Good stuff. We also took some sake bombs! We all played Texas Hold 'em for a few hours, and guess who won? I did. For the first time, I actually won in Poker. =) I won about $60. It was pure luck, because I kept getting good cards....I actually won on the river card a few times. One time I won on the kicker card. And a few times I just bluffed. Of course, we also played Mafia! Happy Birthday Diep! Chris's Birthday Friday night, my friend Chris turned 26. He celebrated w/ a bunch of friends at BJ's Brewery in Cupertino. Pretty cool place! We had an all you can eat buffet of pizza, pasta, and salad. Happy Birthday bro!

Blog Slacker That is what I am. Come back next week. =) Weekend in Review I basically hung out with Olivia the entire weekend. Friday, we watched TV at Olivia's place. Saturday, we continued our hunt for a reception location that fits perfectly with our needs (size, venue, location, and price$$). We visited South San Francisco Conference center, where my sister had her wedding. We also visited the Pacific Athletic Club in Redwood City...nice, too! We also celebrated Christina's 26th Birthday at a Hawaiian Restaurant in SF, which was fun. Sunday, we went shopping, I got a new cell phone, and we hung out with Bev and Gary! Gary showed me his apple computer, and motivated me to finally get one! I'm now on the hunt for a new apple. Of course, it's dependent on our budget. =) Work Work is also getting interesting. Basically, too much politics going on, and non-stop changes. It does scare me, as far as job security is concerned...but all I can do is focus on my projects and do well. Rich Dad, Poor Dad I found the book lying in Olivia's room, so I started to read it. GREAT BOOK! I'm on the last chapter, and I plan on rereading it again. It's an easy read, and you can totally relate it. The book does motivate you to think differently, which I intend to do finacially. Lot's of great points throughout the book, and I highly recommend it for those who want to get out of the "Rat Race" world most of us live in.

Reception Hunting Continues Is this all I ever talk about? Well, that's because my fiancee and I are still on the hunt for a reception location. Hopefully by the end of this month, we will have decided on a place! Last weekend, we visited The Clarion, near SFO. The grand ballroom was really nice, good packages, location is fine, seat covers and cake are included, and we were able to negotiate on the prices! So this is one of our top 3 locations. Bye Bye Manager Last Friday my manager got laid off from work. So our team went out during lunch to a Thai Restaurant, as a going away. According to upper management, my manager didn't meet certain expectations, and asked her to leave. I felt bad, seeing someone get the boot, after they put a lot of effort into their job. But I guess that's the way it goes, if you don't meet expectations, you're at risk. It does make me feel uncomfortable about work and job security. All I can really do is work hard and smart, and do well on my projects. Job security is definitely a false reality. Happy Birthday Kitchie Valentine's day was also Kitchie's Bday. She celebrated at an Ethiopian Restaurant called The Blue Nile, in Berkeley. Definitely an interesting place, but it's lots of fun eating Ethiopian food. You should try it! Sick I think I got the flu. I'm sneezing and coughing, and I feel so tired. The weather isn't helping. I just want to go home and sleep. Another pair bites the dust Congrats to Darren and Stacy!

Wedding Fairs We attended one last night, at the Decathlon Club in Santa Clara. What I love most about them are the freebies! Last night they passed out champagne, delicious appetizers, and pieces of cake! Not only that, we got a chance to talk to a variety of wedding vendors, from videographers to florists to honeymoon planners. Seeing all these people offering their services, made me realize that weddings = BIG business! I think if I ever start a small business, it would have to be related to weddings...maybe videography. Texas Hold'em Mark held a Lakers vs Kings night, so after the wedding fair we passed by. Olivia wanted to see Diana's big belly, since it's been 6 months already! Diana showed us her sonogram of her baby, which were really cool! I thought they were funny because the pictures had arrows labeled "boy" pointing to a little spike....it was the baby's little wee-wee! =) We also played Texas Hold'em, which is so addicting! It was a precursor to their Casino night next weekend. $1 buy-in! Diana swept the house, adding $5 to her baby fund. I wonder how much she'll sweep next weekend for her birthday! =) Watch out everyone, she's good! =)

UML in 24 Hours That's the book I'm reading now. Unified Modeling Language...fun stuff! I took a class that taught UML at Santa Clara, but that was 4 years ago. I need to freshen up on the language. Our Software department has been integrating UML into our current software development process this past year, and from I've seen, it's made a huge impact on all our projects! UML is basically a visual modeling language, that enables system builders to create blueprints that capture ideas in a standard, easy to understand way, and provides a mechanism to effectively share and communicate these designs with others. We started creating UMLs for all our major projects last year, and I have found it useful for all the projects I've worked on. Interesting read! Maxim To balance everything out, I switch over to Maxim. Yes, definitely a great read. It has better pictures than UML diagrams! =) March has Elisha Cuthbert on the cover. Nice. Over due Library Books I have about 10 itmes checked out of the Union City public library, that were due February 4th. Luckily I was able to renew then online. I love technology!

Reception Hunting is Over! Yes, this past weekend, our hunt for a reception location finally ended. Olivia and I finally decided on a place, one that met all of our criteria. Actually, in many ways, it exceeded all our criteria and expectation, and that's why we chose it. First of all, the location is excellent. At first we considered having it in Berkeley, since that's where she went for college. Since the ceremony will be in Santa Clara, the drive for our guests would have been difficult. Well, the reception will be a 5-10 minute drive away! The building / hotel is beautiful. Once you drive towards it, the hotel has a really nice look and feel to it. Cool water fountains decorate the front, beautiful entrance as you walk in, and plenty of parking spaces. Many places we went to looked horrible and ghetto on the outside, and the people we met with tried extremely hard to sell the place. This place spoke for itself. The service is excellent, the ballroom is beautiful, their chairs are really nice (no need for chair covers), the bathrooms are great, the package is terrific, and the price...let's just say our budget has a smile on it's face! For a 4 Star hotel, I'm happy with our choice. =) We're having it at the urlLink Westin Hotel, in Santa Clara. What's Next? I'm so happy that this part of the wedding planning is over! We spent a lot of time, and gas, visiting different locations, asking the same questions, going over packages upon packages, etc. Seeing what we liked, and what we didn't like, made it worth the while when we finally picked this location. We booked the Church, booked the Priest, and decided on a reception location! =) It's nice to have some of the big stuff out of the way! I guess it's now time to work on the smaller details. Oh joy! Gift Registry Olivia and I went to Crate and Barrel Sunday, to register for our wedding. They had a special event for couples, to register for gift items. Crate n Barrel gave us a free pair of champagne flutes! =) I didn't really find too many items there that I really liked. We were sort of forcing ourselves to scan some items. Many things had too much color, like bright orange, yellow, green, blue. I'm looking for a lot of natural colors, earthy tones, like brown, beige, whites, dark brown, etc. I think Olivia and I want to decorate our future home w/ a earthy feel. I thought they would have a good selection of wicker type baskets, but unfortunately they didn't. I want to decorate our home w/ lot's of natural looking things, with lot's of green plants (artifical is fine), with brushed stainless steel accessories in the kitchen. Yes, I already have ideas for decorating our future home! Kitty found a Boyfriend! Last week, as I drove into my garage, Kitty ran outside to play. She usually does that, as she likes to run around, climb the trees, play hide and seek in the bushes. As I was removing my bag from my trunk, I noticed in the corner of my eye, another cat jumped on top of Kitty, and started humping away! It appeared that Kitty was getting attacked by another cat, so I dropped by bag, and started waving my arms and screaming to scare the other cat. I thought Kitty was getting raped. The other cat jumped off of Kitty as I came closer, but apparently Kitty wasn't afraid of the other cat. She followed the other cat, and they both ran off together! I think she found a boyfriend! I went inside to tell my dad, and he came outside to take a look. We started to look for Kitty a few houses away. As we walked a few steps, we heard Kitty scream this high pitched cat scream...as if she was getting raped! Yes, that freaked me out, and I didn't know what to do. The other cat was huge, probably twice the size of kitty. I thought she might of been killed or was getting raped! Well, midnight came, and Kitty was no where to be found. That night, I looked out my window, and called Kitty's name. And I saw her hiding in the bush in front of the house. She walked out towards my call, and right behind her was the other cat! Either this other cat is her boyfriend, and waited for her to get inside her home, or this cat is stalking her. I thought it was cute, but scary at the same time. My dad said that Kitty is a big girl now, and is probably tired of sitting in the garage, where it lives. She's all grown up now, ready to have a relationship with other cats. Every time I open our garage, she runs our looking in the direction where she met her boyfriend. And she would run off, as if she knew where he lived. It's kinda sad, seeing her run off like that, and coming home late at night. I brought her into our house, when she was just a tiny kitty, 6 inches long. I fed her and took care of her, and now she's all grown up now. Now, she's running around at night with the neighborhood cats, playing hookie w/ a boy! Yes, I think my Kitty is going to have babies!

Pho Night Friday night, Loan hosted another "Pho Night" at her family's house in San Jose. Her mom cooked pho for everyone, and it tasted delicious. Unfortunately I didn't have any meat in my bowl, due to Lent, so I passed on the various meat ingredients and created a 'vegetarian' bowl. Good stuff. We also played games, like Catch Phrase and Texas Hold'em. Diana, the official queen of the game, won the tournament that night again! She's definitely earning good money for her baby funds. I'm looking forward to her Casino night next Friday. =) Passion of Christ Saturday afternoon, Olivia and I met up with Dale, Lisa, Rowena, and Jay at Milpitas Great Mall, to watch The Passion of Christ. Rowena invited us to watch the movie w/ her, since her church got tickets. After seeing all the previews on television, listening to tons of discussions about the movie, watching the making of the movie on TV, and hearing it on the radio, I felt excited to finally watch it. The movie contained very powerful scenes, many scenes of pain, torture, blood, suffering...made me cringe a bit during the film. The movie did give me a clearer picture and understanding of the magnitude of pain and suffering that Jesus suffered for the forgiveness of our sins. Overall, I thought it was a great movie. Very powerful. Thai Food After the movie, Olivia, Dale, Lisa, and I went to eat at this Thai restaurant outside of the theaters. Good stuff! Olivia and I ordered their pineapple fried rice and pad Thai. I can still taste it! Shopping for Wedding Bands Olivia found the band she wants, and I found a band I thought was cool. We're buying them at Kay's, since I have about $1500 in Santa Certificates towards any purchase. The one Olivia picked out goes well with her engagement ring. I couldn't find a band that matches hers exactly, but I did see a band I did like. It was white gold, with either 1/4 karat tw, or 1/2 karat tw diamonds along the front. I thought this band looked nice, but was wondering if guys get wedding bands lined with diamonds? Usually I've seen simple bands, traditional white or gold bands, but haven't seen anyone yet w/ diamonds. I'm just glad that bands are relatively affordable, compared to other wedding expenses. Bands can run as low as $99! My certificates end in July, so we have time to pick something out. No Soda I drink lot's of soda, which is BAD BAD BAD! I probably buy a can of soda everyday at work during lunch. Well, that's what I've given up for Lent. So far so good, but I'm starting to crave some Dr. Pepper or Mountain Dew. Olivia gave up meat for Lent, which I thought is a great sacrifice. At the Thai Restaurant we ate it, picking dishes that she could eat was challenging. We had to order dishes w/ no meat! I'm glad that she's not vegetarian all year round, because I love meat!

Softball Season Underway We played our first softball game Wednesday night, at urlLink Twin Creeks in Sunnyvalle. Masterbatters, our team name, got some cool team shirts this year! Fun game, but there were some good and bad news from that night. GOOD News= WE WON, 14-12! Our team played well, and came back from behind to take the lead. Not bad for our first game of the season. Plus we looked cool w/ our new shirts! =) BAD News= I injured my knee, and I was out the rest of the game, w/ a bumb leg. PAINFUL!!! What Happened? In Softball, there's two bags at first, an inside bag (for the first baseman), and an outside bag (for the runner). It's designed to prevent collisions between these two players. On my first at bat and hit, I ran towards first, and the first baseman suddenly backs up into both bags, blocking my path. He backed up his entire body as he was making the catch, covering both bags...and I ran right into him. My left leg/knee slammed right into him, and I toppled over him. Ouch...did that hurt. As a result, my left leg was in pain, right in my knee, and I was out for the game. I did make 2 at bat appearances, just to avoid an automatic out for the team. At least the guy I ran into felt bad. He said it was his first game, and didn't know the rules. He gave me 2 tokens. A Trip to the Hospital Well, today after work, I went to Kaiser Permanente to have a doctor take a look. Fortunately there were no broken bones or torn cartilage. According to the doctor, he didn't see any major damage or injury, just possibly a sprained knee. He said since I was able to walk around, and bend my legs, and no broken bones or clicking/locking at the knee...it's most likely a sprined knee. If it gets worse in 10 days, I need to go back and have it examined again. Rollin on Crutches I did get crutches to avoid putting weight on it, and a knee brace for support. I'll be on them for a few weeks. Yes, it's no fun feeling injured. Tahoe Weekend My family is going to Tahoe this weekend. Unfortunately I won't be able to snowboard due to my injury. That would of been my first time this season, but now it'll have to wait until my knee heals up. I was looking forward to it too! Oh well, at least I'll save some money. SJ Mercury 10K Plus the SJ Mercury 10K is next weekend, but I might not be able to run it. I've been training for it the passed 2 weeks, and it sucks that my knee is out of commission, due to softball. Plus I paid the registration! I'm definitely going to have to show up, just to get my tshirt and some free food! Maybe I'll run it with my crutches.

It's a Beautiful Day! The rain is gone, and the sun is out! That puts a smile on my face! Pool Last night, I shot some pool at urlLink South First billiards w/ my coworker after work. They have a $10/table special, every Monday from 7-10pm. I haven't played in a long time, so most of my shots were mostly off. I did win a few games, by luck. =) San Jose Mercury 10K I've been doing a lot of running that past week, to condition for the SJ Mercury 10K, on March 21st. I'm such a slow runner, but I don't mind. I feel really good after I do run, and I'm sure my body and heart are thanking me. I haven't been as active physically in a long time, so it's nice to pick up running again. I have about 1.5 weeks left to condition. Olivia is going to do the 5k, and I'm proud of her for running a lot, too! We ran together Sunday, and she's pretty good! San Diego - Camp Pendleton Mud Run Plus we have the urlLink Camp Pendleton Mud Run , San Diego in June. A large group of us are going this year (25+), and I'm looking forward to it! That weekend should be lot's of fun. I think we're planning to go to Tijuana afterwards to party! Westin Hotel Last Saturday, we finally got the contract for our wedding reception from the urlLink Westin . I'm excited for the big day, and for the actual reception. We have so much more planning to do, but it's nice to not worry about the hotel. The place looked gorgeous, especially when it's sunny. We're having a winter wedding in January, so hopefully the sun will come out and play on our big day! Casino Night Last Friday, Diana celebrated her birthday with a Casino night. Lot's of fun. I lost overall, but had a great time playing Texas Holdem, blackjack, and bingo. =) Happy Birthday Diana!

Weekend in Tahoe My family celebrated my little sister’s 21st birthday, with a weekend in South Lake Tahoe. We stayed at the Americana Village, on Pioneer Trail, just walking distance to the casinos. It felt good to get away from everything, to see new scenery, play in the snow, spend quality time with the family, go swimming, do some gambling, feast at Harrah’s buffet, walk under the sun, take pictures, visit the Lake, and just relax, relax, relax! It felt like a mini-vacation, and I can’t wait for our next getaway, which is New York for Olivia’s graduation in May! Pictures from this past weekend coming soon! Gambling I did lose $125 in gambling. To me, that’s a lot of money! When you’re on a losing streak, it’s best to just stop gambling…otherwise your hole gets deeper and deeper. That’s my lesson learned, a costly lesson. I lost $40 playing Pai Gow. I lost another $40 at Blackjack. I didn't feel the luck, but I played more Blackjack, and yes…lost another $40. And of course, slots just eat up all your quarters. Well, that’s gambling! Stop when you’re ahead, and stop when you’re on a losing streak! Happy 21st Birthday Audrey! My little sister did win a lot, and had a hot streak at the tables! I think she won the most amongst us. I think I'll try gambling on my next birthday!

San Jose Mercury 10k Sunday morning, a bunch of our friends joined the SJ Mercury 10k. I signed up for the 10k, but ended up walking the 5k, due to my bum knee. It was tough walking it, and probably not the best idea. It took me 56 minutes to hobble 3.1 imles. Afterwards, my knee started to throb w/ pain. Seeing people of all ages running, made me want to run! Seeing old people run as fast or even faster than the younger runners, motivated me to get into running... so that when I'm old, I'll still be able to run as well as the youngsters. Afterwards, lot's of free food and drinks. Some of us even walked away w/ lot's of goodies. Overall, fun day! To bad the pictures I took didn't come out. Only about 5 out of 30 shots came out. I think my camera may be having some issues. Another Casino Night Friday night, we had more gambling fun at Casa Pickerel, for Joey's birthday. We played more Texas Holdem, casino style, and this time I won about $9. I love that game, but only when I win hands. =) Happy Birthday Joey. Bocce Ball Ever play this game? It's lots of fun. Our team at work had an offsite social in Los Gatos, and we played for hours. It's a relatively simple game, but there's actually a lot of strategy involved. I'm thinking about buying a bocce ball set.

TGIF!!!!!!!! Yes, it's Friday today! Plus it's beautiful outside, with the sun shining bright! I'm definitely looking forward to the weekend! I'm stuck in the office right now, with so much work to do. I need to finish up as much as I can, so I don't have to worry about catching up over the weekend! Weekend Plans No big plans this weekend. So far, here is what I have planned: Saturday Wash my car - haven't washed it in months! Mark and Diana's baby shower - they're having a house party Possiby Great America - Olivia won WoW season passes on the radio Sleep - I need to catch up Sunday Church Laundry Clear out my junk! Speaking of Junk... I still have all my papers/books/homework/etc. from Elementary school, High school, and College. I honestly don't think I need any of it these days, but it's hard for me to just throw these items away. I'm thinking they're worth keeping, so that someday I can show my kids my old school work. We'll see....I might just toss them out this weekend.

New Cell Phone After almost 5 years with Cingular Wireless, sportin' my Nokia 6190, I finally switched to AT&T Wireless and got a new phone! Yes, I've told myself that I would never EVER replace my 6190, because this phone is bullet proof! Nothing could break this cell phone. I've dropped it a million and one times, I've tossed it up against the wall like a basketball, I've submerged it water...and it has survived until now, still going strong. Gotta Save Money Well, since Olivia and I are getting married, we're trying to find ways to save money! So we got the family plan with AT&T, for $39.99 + 9.99 / month! That includes 600 shared minutes, unlimited nights/weekends, free mobile to mobile, nationwide! Not a bad deal, considering we were paying $80+ for both our current plans. Since most of my minutes are used calling Olivia, having free mobile to mobile is great. I love my New Nokia 3200 Yes, I thought my Nokia 6190 was the bomb. But now I love my new urlLink Nokia 3200! It's such an awesome phone. Maybe it's just because I'm a few generations behind in cell phones, but this phone is great, with many features! My favorite feature is the built in FM Radio that automatically mutes during calls. Yes, I've been using my phone at work to listen to the radio! It has a built in speaker phone, to allow you to talk hands free. Not only that, you can use the speaker phone to listen to the radio out loud! The built-in camera with picture editor, 10-second timer and night mode works great. The quality was surprisingly better than expected. Customizable design-your-own, cut-out front/back covers. Olivia and I signed up for the mMode package for a month, which included internet access, text messaging, email, picture sending. The internet access is pretty cool. I can read email, go on AIM, visit Yahoo, check news, sports, stock quotes, etc. Plus, this cell phone has a built in Flashlight! The best part about this phone, is that I can vote for my favorite American Idol. =)

Busy, Busy, Busy! I've been so busy at work this entire week, I can't wait for the weekend. My new manager started on monday, and he's actually a pretty cool guy. He has great experience and new ideas, it's refreshing to have someone with lot's of energy to lead our group. This month I'm the team lead for our release, which is the main reason why I'm so busy. I have about 3-4 meetings a day, which takes up most of my time. As a result, I'm behind in my own work. I may need to work this weekend just to catch up. But I'm actually enjoying this rotating role, as it's a great learning experience. Almost there! Olivia and I are almost there! We've been working on this big project since November, and so far we're on track. Hopefully all goes well! We should be done by May! =) Retainers I started wearing my retainers again. =) They're not those regular metal type ones, but a mouth piece type of retainer. They actually work! =)

Go Olivia! After work today, I went to Alameda to watch Olivia play softball. All I can say is "WOW!" Olivia played second base, and did an awesome job. I cheered for her and her team, as I sat on the bleechers to watch. She made some amazing plays at second base, and I was truly impressed with her defensive skills. She almost threw out several players at first, but the runners beat her out. That's okay Olivia, we'll work on getting more speed in your throws. Olivia's had an RBI, a walk, and a run. WOW! Congrats congrats! I want to play! Ever since I injured my knee in our first softball game a month or so ago, I've been dying to play! I haven't been able to go running, play basketball, play softball, or anything active. My knee feels like it's getting better, but I'm afraid if I start running and putting too much pressure on the knee, it will get worse. So I've letting my knee heal, doing stretches and stairs to keep it flexible and gain strength. 30 more days to go! It's an exciting month this month, and the countdown has begun. Oh boy, I can't wait! Oh, I'll also be on vacation for a week and a half next month. We're going to New York for Olivia's graduation ceremony. She graduated last year, but missed the grad ceremony. Olivia's family and I are flying there for a week to see her in her cap and gown, to get her masters diploma. I'm so looking forward to that trip, since work has been busy and hectic. It should be fun. Go Giants I love the Giants. Congrats to Barry Bonds for Homerun 660! Wedding Plans Our wedding plans have been in the slow lane the past few weeks. I gues we've taken a break from planning, and working on other projects. We do have our major items taken care of, but we still have a lot more planning to do! Right now, we're just enjoying being engaged! =) Strange Olivia received a gift from someone in the mail the other day. The person who sent it didn't say who they were. It's a nice gift, but kinda strange not knowing who it's from. Soda Now that Lent is over, I started drinking soda again! It tastes so good. =) I love Dr. Pepper...so much sugar!

Kitty Litter Kitty, our pet cat, gave birth to 3 little kittens last week. One white kitten, one black kitten, and one black and white. I actually witnessed one of the births, which I found fascinating....the miracle of birth! Seeing it pop out, and hearing the little meows and crying for the first time...was definitely miraculous. Watching the new born kittens, all helpless, blind, and deaf, and seeing Kitty become a mother for the first time, definitely was a site to see. I wish I video taped the whole thing. =) So now, we have 4 cats living in our garage, and my family doesn't know what to do with them. We'll, we're going to keep them until the babies are able to walk and eat on their own. Then we'll either donate them, call the animal shelter, or make arroz caldo. =) Bye Bye Apple On the sad side, Apple, my pet turtle, passed away today. Yes, sad day today. I found her upside down in the water tank where she lives with Big. Big, my other turtle, is now all alone. Tear. I got them over a year ago, in New York. The past few weeks, both turtles haven't been eating the turtle food I give. I think they've been unhappy, as they seldom run around and play. I guess living in a confined space, can seem hopeless and pointless for a turtle, as they should be living free in the ocean or beach. I'm thinking of setting Big free, so he can enjoy the rest of his life! Reminds me of Finding Nemo. Apple, we will miss you! Saffron Last night Olivia and I went on a triple date with Mark, Diana, Nick and Diep. We had dinner at San Carlos, at an Indian restaurant called Saffon. Great place, delicious dishes, great atmosphere, very different from your typical Indian restaurants. Mark actually worked with the owner/chef before, so the chef hooked us up with some free dishes, and a 10% discount. Unfortunately, when Olivia got home, she threw up...possibly due to food poisoning. But I do recommend this place if you love Indian food. Busy at Work I am swamped at work. Release after Release, conference calls upon conference calls, meetings within meetings, it's been a hectic month, and will continue being hectic for the entire year. I'm looking forward to my vacation in New York!

Good News!!!!!! Last Thursday at work, I received a call from my sister Abby. "Guess what, you're going to be an uncle!" At first I thought that Char, who is pregnant, had her baby. I quickly realized that she has only been pregnant for a few months...so that couldn't be. A few seconds later I realized that my sister and Mike were going to have a baby!! I felt really happy to hear such good news! It's exciting when one of your siblings are going to have kids, it makes you realize how time flies so fast. One day you're 3 years old playing in the park and fighting with your sister. Next thing you know, your older sister is having a baby, and you're going to be an uncle. My parents are extremely happy about Abby having a baby. Both my parents have been waiting a long time to be grandparents, especially my dad. He wants to retire so he can take care of his grandchildren. =) It's nice to know that they're looking forward to that. Congratulation Mike and Abby! You're both going to be great parents! I hope it's a boy! =)

Columbia University Graduation Today we witnessed Olivia receive her M.A. degree from urlLink Columbia University , from the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences. We were fortunate enough to all get into St. Paul's Chapel, where the ceremony occurred, to watch Olivia walk down the aisle. The school only gave 2 tickets per student, but after everyone w/ tickets sat down, a few seats were left! Seeing Olivia in her cap and gown, made me proud! She looked great in her Columbia blue graduation outfit, you'll have to see pictures of what I mean. =) Cute! Congratulations again Olivia! Monsoon's After the ceremony and taking pictures during the reception, we had lunch at a Vietnamese Restaurant called urlLink Monsoon's . It's one of Olivia's favorite Vietnamese restaurants in the city. The food was good! Who Wants To Be A Super Millionaire Today we also went to the ABC studios, to watch a filming of urlLink "Who Wants to be a Super Millionaire" . Despite waiting for almost 1.5 hrs, watching the contestants play, seeing how they produced the show, witnessing the re-takes, laughing at the jokes, and seeing Regis, the show was very entertaining! They even gave the entire audience a cool t-shirt! The taping will be aired this Wednesday night, so tell me if you see us in the audience! Acqua Restaurant For dinner, Olivia and I went on a dinner date by ourselves. We ate at urlLink Acqua Restaurant , an Italian restaurant located in the upper west side. Great place for pasta! The weather was kind, so we ate outside along the side walk. That's always a lot of fun. Olivia and I finally got a chance to just sit and spend time together, since our trip schedule has been jammed-packed with non-stop new York paced moving. We had a great conversation! We talked about religion, our future, our dreams, our concerns, our parents, our family, our plans, and our lives. So much to figure out and talk about!!! Troy Monday night, we watched urlLink Troy , starring Brad Pitt, Orlando Bloom, Diane Kruger, and Eric Bana. Great epic movie!!!! Orlando Bloom's role as Paris was funny...watching him act as a coward, and then seeing him bust out with bows and arrows. He reminded me of Legolas. Brad Pitt did a good job. H&M We all went shopping at urlLink H&M ! I love this store. I bought a bunch of new shirts for work, for affordable prices. If there's any place to go shopping in New York, for affordable clothing, it's H&M. =)

New York!!!! Today is Sunday, and guess where I'm? Ok, I guess my heading gave it away. I'm in New York! I love this city, and it's great to be here. Such a fast paced environment, lot's to do, different sights to see, sounds to hear, interesting smells to smell, different from your typical day in the Bay. There's definitely no place like NY. I love the subways. We arrived Saturday morning and checked into the apartment Olivia booked. Nice cosy place in Manhatan, enough to fit 7 of us comfortably. Gray's Papaya Let's see, what did we do so far? We first had lunch at urlLink Gray's Papaya , a popular hotdog spot, known for their 75 cent hotdogs and papaya drinks. They're actually remodeling the place, and according to their sign, the rent of the building went up. So the hotdog prices went up to 95 cents. Boo! Still a great deal. Boy from Oz After our Chinese take-out dinner, we watched the musical urlLink "The Boy from Oz", starring Hugh Jackman. Olivia bought tickets a long time ago, when she was still living in New York. Overall, it was a great show. Hugh Jackman played his character well! Party After the show, we went to a graduation party where we saw a bunch of UCB alum. We had a few drinks and danced a bit. It was at one of Donald Trump's apartment buildings, very nice. Saint Patrick's Sunday, we went to Church at urlLink Saint Patrick's Cathedral . An usher asked to do the collection, which I actually enjoyed! I held the basket and walked down the rows of pews, collecting donations. =) International Food Fair After church, we went to the urlLink Ninth Avenue International Food Festival , which is held each May. Thousands of people and hundreds of vendors selling food from all over the world, souvenirs, clothing, drinks, music, and lot's of fun. We tried a variety of foods which were delicious. I bought 4 sets of bedsheets for $10 a set. =) Garment District Olivia wanted to shop for bridemaid's dresses, so she took us to the Garmnent District. Plenty of shops with hundreds of dresses, for low prices. She had trouble finding dresses in the color of our wedding theme, so we have to go back again to dig deeper for dresses. Malaysia Grill We had dinner tonight at urlLink Malaysia Grill . Great place for malaysian food. =) So far, I'm having a great time in New York. The day's are flying by quick! Upcoming plans include The View, Regis and Kelly, more musicals, Serendity, clubbing, and lot's of shopping!
I love Mud Here's my favorite picture of Olivia getting down and dirty!!!

Welcome Back! Yes, I'm back again, and so is my website. After paying for 1 year of hosting, and free loading for an additional 2 years of web hosting, my host finally caught on and deactivated my account. =) So I got a new host from a friend, www.icestorm.com. Check them out if you need webhosting! Anyways, I decided to toss away my entire site and start fresh. 2 Months in Review Lot's has happened since the last time I blogged...so much, I don't know where to begin. Well, to keep it short, here are the biggest highlights in the past 2 months: - Olivia and I moved into our new home! We finally closed escrow, and started to move in over a month ago. We've pretty much been been painting like there's no tomorrow. Moving is a lot of work, and boy oh boy, it takes a lot of work and energy. But it's definitely exciting, and we're having so much fun! - I ran the 10K Mud Run in Camp Pendleton, in San Diego! Yes, it's now our annual event. A bunch of our friends went down for the weekend, to run a 10K obstacle course full of mud, hills, water, rivers, tires, sand, etc. LOT'S OF FUN!!!! - Went to Char and Abe's Wedding, in Vallejo. The reception was at Hs Lordships in Berkeley Marina. Beautiful couple, beautiful wedding! - I almost lost 2 important people in my life: my little sister Audrey and Ben(practically my litlte brother) to a car accident, on Memorial Day weekend. I'm so thankful that they are both alive today. That event gave myself and my family a big scare and an emotional rollercoaster ride. But we're so glad God was kind that day. It really put life into perspective for me, to realize how life is so precious, that in a sudden instant, it could be changed forever. Family is what matters for me, and I'm so thankful to God for sparing both their lives that day. Ben is still in the hospital, but is recovering everyday! - Work, work, work! Just been busy at work, learning lot's of new things. I have actually learned more in the past two months with my new manager, than in the past 2+ years I've been at Covad. and that's pretty much it for now.

I'm tired, and I can't wait for the weekend. Work has been tough and very demanding, but has been a great learning experience. Guess what...I have to work this weekend. Boo. This past 3 day weekend was awesome, and I wonder when the next one is. Last weekend, went to a BBQ in Danville, where Johanna threw a little party. We went swimming in her neighborhood pool. Then on Sunday, Olivia and I worked on our new place. We did more painting, bought some blinds for the windows, installed them. So now we no longer have our yellow bedsheets as curtains. =) We also purchased a ceiling fan which we installed. I was able to convince Olivia to pick something I really liked, a model called "The West Indies". It's starting to grow on her, and I'm glad she agreed to it. Monday, my family came over for a bbq. Ben's family came over as well, and so did Ben. It was nice to see him up and about, walking and talking like before. One month ago, he was in the hospital, barely awake. Now, he's recovering well. =) We played some Texas Hold 'em, some Upwords, and Cranium. Tomorrow is Friday, and I can't wait for the weekend!

Blog Slacker Ok, enough people have told me I'm slacking w/ this blog of mine...I've finally come around to post a new entry. Let's work backwards! George and Nina's Wedding Our friends from Santa Clara, George and Nina tied the knot yesterday at the Santa Clara Mission. Beautiful day, beautiful wedding, beautiful couple. They had their reception at the Grand Hyatt Hotel in Burlingame. Nice place! Despite our waiter forgetting to serve our table by the time other guest started the main course, the dinner was excellent. We started off w/ a pumkin clam chowder, followed by a shrimp appetizer, salad, sourbet, filet mignon, coffee, and wedding cake! The one thing I thought was awesome was their wedding slide show. They had a cartoon animation of themselves w/ voice overs, talking about their history and background. Creative Stuff!!! They had both pictures and video in their slideshow, which I really enjoyed. Olivia will be posting the pics we took on ofoto. Adios Amigos Night Jane and Oscar threw a party at Jane's place, for Rick and Eileen who are moving out of town. A going away party, before they leave for Chicago and San Diego. We met up at Jane's and Oscar played bartender for the night. We also had dinner at Rick's favorite Taco Truck in Oakland. GYGO5 Last weekend, Olivia and I threw our annual barbecue / picnic games event, "Get Your Grub On", for the 5th straight year. We typically invite all our friends and family, to come out to some park, play some games for cool prizes, eat, and have fun under the sun. This year we held it in the park in our new neighborhood, so it was nice and convenient for us. =) We actually had the entire park to ourselves! Great turnout this year, friends from high school, college, work, and family attended. It's always nice to see the different groups of people we know, all at one place. And it's nice seeing people smile and having fun. We had some classic games this year, w/ a few new ones. The games included: 1) Scavenger Hunt 2) Water Balloon Toss 3) Hockey / Golf Relay Race 4) Water Sponge Relay 5) Water Balloon Volleyball The Winners this year, were the Red Period team, and won themselves a cool car wash kit! They have won 3 out of the 5 GYGOs. Congrats Congrats! Thanks again to everyone for coming out, and see you all again next year, GYG06! Aids Walk Olivia and I also did the San Francisco Aids walk two weeks ago. We walked with Eric, Marjorie, Jane, and Oscar. Lot's of fun. Afterwards, we ate at Sinugba's in Daly City, and hopped into Olivia's spa for some relaxation! Work, Work, Work... ...that's all Olivia says I do, WORK! Yes, I've been getting hammered at work. So far, our past 3 software releases have bombed! Reason being, we have very aggressive software release schedules with unrealistic dates. So many initiative and projects, which leads to poor planning and poor software quality. That definitely doesn't look good for our Software Engineering department. As a result, there's a lot of changes going on, such as new processes, delays in our future release, and more work to do!! The only thing keeping me going is the team I'm on. We as a group have really united, compared to the past, and we're learning so much from each other. Learning as much as I can is all I look forward to these days at work. =) House Stuff Olivia and I have been enjoying our new home. There's still quite a lot to do, and buy...but we're doing things one step at a time. So far we've been able to paint our entire first floor (minus the bedrooms). We've purchase and installed our new kitchen table set, which we love a lot. We also bought our new refrigerator, so now I can return my little sister's college dorm room fridge. And we've installed our new ceiling fan. =) Oh, can't forget that we've installed some window blinds. For the longest time, we've had yellow bedsheets as window coverings. And yes, we finally got DSL!!!! What else to be done you ask? LOTS! That includes: - painting the garage - painting the bedrooms - complete all the window blinds - buy a couch - pick out a dining room set (which Abby+ Mike are going to get us as a wedding/house warming gift) - sign up for cable - decorate, decorate, and decorate!
